Review Text: good reviews don’t even do justice for how good Khao-So-I is. The food is excellent, the environment is lively and lovely. The restaurant is so busy but staff are so attentive!! Staff make excellent recommendation of dishes without upselling their more expensive dishes or anything. We’ve had other Khao Soi, including Michelin guided shops but this is the best one for me and my husband. This may not be your everyday Khao Soi. We are tourists here and here to enjoy & experience things !! Worth every penny.

This seemed like a fusion take on khao soi, and overall it was great. The khao soi was very spicy and cover the taste of shrimp and scallops. but the staff were extremely caring when he noticed I was sweating and can’t handle with the spicy, he proactively offered extra coconut milk and pork broth to mellow the soup. However, the yogurt dessert’s texture was too hard and not creamy enough. If you can handle the spicy soup, you might want to skip dessert at a khao soi restaurant 😆

We came to Khao-Sō-i to try the typical and traditional dish of Chiang Mai. I ate the Khao-soi with Braised Beef. Here you can choose to have your dish with spicy curry broth (traditional version), or you to have stir-fried noodles without broth and therefore not spicy. Before choosing, the waitress was very kind as she brought me a small bowl with a taste of the broth, so I could taste and understand how spicy it was. In the end, I chose to have it in soup format with broth and diluted it with coconut milk to tone down the spiciness. We ate very well, it’s a must-try dish to try if you are in Chiang Mai.

The best fusion Khao Soi in Chiangmai, great atmosphere like old town Tokyo, very organised. Go early the best way is no queue and ending with soft ice cream, same quality as it in Tokyo. Don’t miss! 😆

A premium Khao Soi restaurant where the flavor is quite balanced, making it suitable for tourists to try. Honestly, the taste is pretty good, but personally, I prefer more local style places. That’s just my personal preference, so it wouldn’t be fair to judge the restaurant based on that. I recommend trying it yourself. Overall, it’s a good place definitely worth a visit if you’ve never had Khao Soi before.
One of best Khao Soi we have in Thailand. Food and ambience are good. The staff attending to us are superb and attentive. Highly recommended to try them out when you are in Chiangmai.

I visited in the morning when it wasn't busy, and the staff were friendly, providing me with recommendations. It's a must-visit if you're in Chiang Mai; the food and atmosphere are great, making it feel like I was in Japan. The food was incredible, delicious, and authentically Northern Thai with a hint of Japanese fusion.
Aoffy was so lovely, the food was incredible and such a beautiful setting. I’ll definitely come back here again. The dumplings were so juicy ans the Khao soi with thai sausage was amazing!!

Khao-Sō-i offers an exceptional dining experience that stands out even in a city renowned for its culinary delights. The restaurant’s signature Khao Soi dish features a rich, creamy curry broth with a perfect balance of spices, complemented by tender meat and a combination of soft and crispy egg noodles and delicious dumplings. This harmonious blend of textures and flavors creates a memorable meal that captures the essence of Northern Thai cuisine. Beyond the food, Khao-Sō-i can be praised for its cozy and clean ambiance, as well as its attentive and friendly service. The toilet, though, needs fixing and renovation. Apart from that, the staff’s dedication to providing a welcoming atmosphere increases the overall dining experience, making everyone feel valued and comfortable. Whether you’re a resident or a traveler exploring Chiang Mai, Khao-Sō-i is a must-visit destination for an authentic and satisfying meal. There’s also a dessert section, where you can relax after your meal and choose from a selection of hot and cold drinks, cream caramel, tiramisu, and a Japanese dessert. All in all, it has been a great experience. I have wanted to try this restaurant, and I am very pleased to do so. If I don't visit again, I will miss the friendly staff.

Khao-Sō-i takes the classic Northern Thai dish to the next level with their impressive Khao Soi 2.0 menu. Every dish is creative yet authentic, with a perfect balance of flavors that highlight the best of Japanese culture and Northern Thai cuisine. Truly one of a kind! The venue itself is nice, clean, and photogenic – great for both foodies and anyone who loves sharing their dining experiences. Prices are very reasonable for the quality you get, and the restaurant is clearly well managed. Add to that a spacious parking area and professional, attentive staff, and you’ve got the full package. Totally loving this place – and without a doubt, I’ll be coming back. A must-visit when in Chiang Mai! 🍜

A very good place for enjoying delicious Khao Soi. The price of Khao Soi is higher than local shops, but it's definitely worth for the food, service and cozy atmosphere. For vegetarian, there are only one option, the tofu Khao Soi. Without the chili paste, the Khao Soi itself is not very spicy. You can add as much chili as you like. The ice cream (mixed) is yummy 😋

The khao soi was really tasty, rich broth and soft noodles with great flavor. The beef was tender and the portion was just right. Service was quick and friendly, and the place has a nice local vibe that makes it comfortable to sit and enjoy the food. Definitely worth trying if you’re around the area.

Disappointing given the prices. Opted for the more premium Tajima Aus Khao Soi beef thinking it would be nice and tender. I could have stayed there chewing it all day and not gotten very far. Despite being the only ones there the order was wrong to what we marked on the order sheet but I was glad I got a small instead of medium in the end. Dumpling were nice. Chicken Khao Soi was good too. The place is nice and presentation also but not good value for money

My first time in Chiang Mai, and this place becoming my first meal here. I ordered Khao So I with Braised Beef and Beef Tendon size small with soup and mineral water. The place not big, not too crowd (so many foreigner, didnt see local there), easy to get seat. My order came fast, it really curry but not too spices. The small size look small, but its okay for me. You can add the coconut milk, chili flakes, vegetable and/or lime inside, but without all of that, the soup still yummy. Lime made it more fresh, i suggest u pour it. The meat was juicy and tender, but the meat portion not so many, but you can add topping. The staff also nice, can speak english, you can pay with QR.

Khao soi with premium touch, but still worth to try. Food taste good , but the dine in area is a bit packed! Waiting list is long but you can capture some photos at the alley with japanese theme there. Worth to try!

Khao-Sō-i is hands down the best spot for Khao Soi in Chiang Mai! 🍜 The beef Khao Soi is absolutely delicious, rich, creamy, and full of flavor that keeps you coming back for more. 😋 If you’re feeling adventurous, try the lobster Khao Soi 🦞, it’s a bit pricey but totally worth it for a special treat. The taste is unique and will definitely impress your taste buds! The restaurant’s interior is beautiful and full of rich cultural vibes, making your meal feel even more special. 🎨✨ It’s a hidden gem perfect for friends to enjoy together. You won’t regret giving it a try! 👍
Thank you, Jenny from Phayao hahaha the service is absolutely fantastic, food is tasty but you cannot choose the spicy level in soups so be prepared for that. The butterfly drink is delicious.

went to the restaurant and the cafe, this is my first time having khao so and this one set the bar for every khao so i tried after. I'd say this the best one i've tried so far, the flavor of the coconut and curry sauce is so rich. It's lowkey spicy for me without even adding the chili flakes. Matcha soft serve is standard but the honeybun is so good !
Very picturesque place decorated in traditional Japanese style. Food is delicious. Also the staff is extremely friendly and welcoming

I had a wonderful dining experience at Khao So I! The star of the show was definitely their signature Khao Soi — rich, creamy curry broth with tender beef and perfectly cooked egg noodles. The dish came with all the essential condiments: pickled mustard greens, red onions, fresh herbs, and crispy noodles — beautifully presented and thoughtfully portioned. The attention to detail was impressive, from the handcrafted ceramic dishes to the warm wooden tray that added a rustic charm. You can tell they care about both flavor and presentation. The ambiance was cozy and intimate, perfect for a relaxed meal with friends or a solo comfort food fix. Service was friendly and attentive. If you’re craving authentic Northern Thai cuisine in KL (or wherever you’re located), Khao So I is a must-visit. I’ll definitely be back to try more from their menu!

Personally I feel it’s overrated, especially given the price. I ordered the small portion and it’s something like 240 baht. The problem is that 1. It’s definitely not enough for a male adult 2. I actually asked the server if it’s enough, and they recommended me the small portion 3. There’s really nothing special about the Khao so. The meat is indeed better than most random food stands, but that’s pretty much it 4. In fact, I felt a bit overwhelmed after the meal. Perhaps it’s that I’m just not a big fan of Khao soi. Still, this place is worth checking out, but not a must for sure

So delicious. Must visit! Recommend the beef tendon and shank soup dishes. We have also tried the pork fried rice. Matcha soft serve is so yummy! But they close down the machine around 7:30-8 pm or so. Order early! Note: • if you do not like spicy, get the dry noodles and ask for no spice. All soup based noodle dishes will be spicy. • if you require gluten free options, they do provide gluten free noodles but you must ask! The GF noodles were almost just as good as the original. I was very impressed.

The atmosphere and food blew me away! Very accessible to those who might not be as tolerant to spice, but preserves the authentic taste of northern Thailand who those who can with a Japanese twist. The service is spectacular, no notes. The atmosphere is very reminiscent of traditional Japan aesthetics and there are many cute photo opportunities in the area. The attention to detail is incredible, down to the fish themed cutlery. 100/10 would come back again
Great food. I tried beef khao soi and the meat was tender and tasty. Dumplings are very delicious. Red syrup tea also eases the spiciness of soup. There are also photogenic spots. Highly recommended.

Excellent food. Honestly the best meal we had in Chiang Mai, maybe even all of Thailand. The spice level was perfect and easy to titrate to your own level. Perfectly balanced flavors. Both the entrees we ordered were spectacular (one soup and one stir-fried). Wish we could come back but, sadly, this is our last day here. Til next time. Also, definitely try the soft serve. I usually don't like matcha, but it was the perfect way to cool us down.

Excellent!!! So good I wanna cry hahaha the curry taste so balance, savory with freshness of the lime juice…chef torched the lobster, it is so fresh the Australian wagyu topping is also amazing I add 2 more portion. The service is also excellent, friendly, and prompt response…Definitely will comeback!

Khao Soi with a twist of modern. Sweet and savory with choice of meats, but I recommend beef shank and tender. Services are perfect with courtesy and a friendly smile. Air condition room with wooden tables and chairs. Feels of authentic Thai sitting style with a/c.

The restaurant was packed with mostly tourists 😆 We were curious of the Khao Soi noodle soup but aren’t really fans of chili or spicy food. We were contemplating if we should give it a try and the lovely staff was nice enough to give us a taste of the soup and to our surprise it’s way too much for us so we opted for the stir fry khao soi instead. Very tasty I love how tender the pork ribs 😋 but we’re kinda disappointed they don’t have the milder version of soup (like some sort of spicy level options) The matcha soft serve was really good it’s a must try 😊

During my recent visit to Chiang Mai, I had the pleasure of stopping by Khao-Sō-i for a late lunch, and it truly exceeded my expectations. I opted for the beef shank khao soi, and I can honestly say it was one of the best dishes I’ve had. The broth was incredibly rich and flavorful, perfectly balanced with a hint of spice that didn’t overwhelm the palate. The beef shank was cooked to perfection—tender and melt-in-your-mouth delicious. To complement my meal, I chose the butterfly pea tea, which was a delightful addition. Its natural sweetness paired beautifully with the savory khao soi, creating a harmonious dining experience. One notable feature was the helpful instructional card provided for those unfamiliar with how to enjoy khao soi. This thoughtful touch made the experience even more enjoyable and accessible to both locals and tourists alike. I also want to highlight the exemplary service from Aoffy, the hostess. She was incredibly kind and sweet, making sure I felt welcomed and comfortable. She spoke very good English, which made our conversation easy and enjoyable. Her initiative to chat with me when she noticed I was traveling alone added a warm and personal touch to my visit. Overall, Khao-Sō-i offers not just delicious food but also a wonderful atmosphere and friendly service. I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Chiang Mai. Whether you're a khao soi aficionado or trying it for the first time, this place is a must-visit!

Very good restaurant. All staff very friendly and helpful. Specially Toa Billy . Good English and very professional. Potential staff . Billy good attitude and good hospitality. Excellent service . Toa good recommendation when presenting the menu . My family and I very enjoy the dinner tonight . Will suggest to my friends and guests also .

the staffs are really nice, they can speak both great english and mandarin, we chatted with the staff a bit, and she explained the menu and helped us order, also to make sure we can take the heat of the khao so i, so she gave us the broth to try before ordering, that's super thoughtful and caring but i didn't get to ask her name, but i think she's super friendly, she even shared her own experience working with p peach pachara with me after knowing i'm a big fan of his 🤣 it's not a restaurant only tourists visit, but there's also many thai people eating, which means the flavor is also good for the locals we had khao soi with beef tongue, khao soi with braised beef and beef tendon, nam prik noom fired rice with fried pork, they all tasted so good! and they kind of performed a bit with the fried rice, like shaping it beside our table, which is super cool and fun to watch for drinks, we had jasmine green tea and chysanthemum tea, the green tea is unsweetened, both of them can refill, it's great bc you might have to cool down the spiciness with the iced drink!

Food: The food was fantastic, with a great variety of meat and seafood. The lobster was a standout, and the soup was incredibly delicious. The ingredients were fresh, and they even offered unlimited vegetables for refill. I requested extra fish sauce, and they happily provided it. Service: The presentation was impressive, and the chefs maintained a clean and organized environment. The staff delivered quick, professional service, making the experience even better. Atmosphere: The atmosphere was excellent—clean, well-organized, and inviting. Additional Touches: The story behind how the restaurant was created is truly inspiring. It’s also worth noting that the restaurant attracts quality customers from around the world.

Loved it! The broth was incredibly rich and flavourful, and the meat was very tender, making each bite super satisfying. The portions of meat were also quite generous compared to other Khao Soi places. The service was attentive and warm-they help you choose the right Khao Soi for you, and even explain how to properly enjoy it, which really elevates the whole experience.

The vegetarian Khao Soi with fried tofu was incredible! Rich, creamy curry broth with just the right amount of spice, and the tofu was perfectly crispy on the outside while soft inside. It was packed with flavour and so comforting!! The staff were so friendly and accommodating — they made sure everything was just right. Easily one of the best vegetarian meals I’ve had in Chiang Mai. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a delicious meat-free option that doesn’t compromise on taste! And don’t forget to finish with their soft serve matcha ice cream!

We had dinner at Khao‑Sō‑i in Chiang Mai and it felt more like dining in a stylish Japanese noodle house than at a typical Thai khao soi joint. The atmosphere was sleek, calm and the open kitchen added a fun energy, watching the chefs prepare each bowl was a highlight. The khao soi itself was delicious, creamy, richly spiced broth, tender meat and perfectly cooked noodles. It’s more refined than street-style versions yet still deeply comforting. Service was professional and friendly. They even provide refillable drinks The place is almost always busy, which makes sense given the quality and clean, inviting decor. There’s a modern, elevated feel without being pretentious. Must have: Get the classic chicken khao soi. Rich, balanced and highly satisfying. Highly recommend if you’re in Chiang Mai and want a polished take on the city’s iconic noodle soup.

Went to this place as this was suggested. I had the stir-fry noodles and it did not disappoint. You can request to not make it spicy, which I did. All the flavors go so well with the meat is is definitely a must-try!

It’s gimmick or (photogenic? )and a bit pricey for the decor. As a tourist, if you want to try Khao soi, I would recommend you to any other local one which is more authentic and at reasonable price. The noodles is so so and the chicken as well. BTW, the chef comes to your table if you order fried rice which makes the indoor having a bit strong kitchen fumes.
The famous Khao Soi with wagyu meat served in Japanese style! I really loved what we got. The restaurant is nice and cozy. We went at night and there was no line!

I think this is the best restaurant ive visited in chiang mai. The food tastes excellent, price wise ok, ambience ok, all's good! Totally highlight of my day here❤️ order the one that I took pic, ebi + gyoza and the crunchy noodle (?) wassss epic

Excellent dining experience, very friendly staff and beautiful place. Noodles with beef was excellent value, but I felt the lobster was not the best value for money. Perhaps should have went for the gyoza instead. I’d still highly recommend the restaurant!
The food is excellent the server assisted us on how to place our order and instructions on how to eat khao soi. The ambiance of s also great 👍🏼
Went with my partner absolutely loved the food everything on our plates was delicious, cant wait for them to open in London. Must try the matcha ice cream was incredible

I came here with my boyfriend. We ordered different things and we both loved it!! So tasty! They also let me taste my soup beforehand to decide if it was too spicy for me 😊 The atmosphere is also nice and the service as well. I'd definitely recommend coming here.

The food, staff and facilities are perfect. We opted to eat here two days in a row as we all loved it that much. I can’t say enough about the food other than everything was perfectly balanced and spiced so impressive !!

The good: * Shank & chuck eye beef khao soi soup was very good * The noodles were very nice * They certainly put a lot of effort into the place – it’s cute and efficient despite the crowd The bad: * Meat arrives cold, which is fine when you mix it into a hot soup, but I don’t recommend the dry version * The chicken wasn’t great – I’ve had much better at a 40 baht chicken rice shop * The ice jasmine tea costs 49+tax and tastes just like water * Pricey in general and they add 10% on top
Beautiful places. Nice customer services. And foods are good and delicious. Aoffy was the waitress who served us and helped us to enjoy the foods. Recommended reastaurant.

I got the best ever Khao-soi from Khao-So-I (Yes, the name of this restaurant is really confusing 😂) The broth is really thick and creamy, strong flavour of coconut cream. The spicy is just perfect for me. The braised beef are soft and tasty. The chuck eye is just boiled, soft but not much flavor The shrimp and Hotate is so fresh and perfect cook, I wonder how the chef can cook so so nice. Very impressive. The chair is not so comfortable to eat, coz it's quite high compare to the table, so you need to bend down qhen eating. There is a girl with beautiful eyes promoted us with Mat ha ice-cream to kill the spicy on our tongue, really nice and smoothy and creamy, strong flavor of Matcha Perfect dinner ever in Chiang Mai.

It’s a Michelin. So expect to pay high prices. However, the food did not disappoint. Best Khao soi I’ve had. You can choose from many different meats such as pork, beef, and seafood. The flavors were deliciously balanced creating a symphony of delight. Do note though, if you can’t tolerate spice, you can only have the “stir fried” version of the dish, not the soup. This is because the way they prepare the broth I believe. Could be a deal breaker for some. But my friend had the stir fried and she said it was also very good. In addition we shared fried tofu and the dumplings both of which were a treat. Worth the money 👍🏼

Probably going to be my favorite Khao Soi place from now on. The traditional taste of Khao SOI is still here but they made their dishes in a very innovative and creative way. Mimi, one of the waitresses was very attentive and welcoming to us customers. Very hard working and courteous. It made my dining experience much much nicer, I took her suggestion for the Khao Soi dumpling! it was really worth trying. It was a busy day when I came in, but the staff were super diligent with follow ups and not needing to be reminded repeatedly. The front line chefs were entertaining to watch. Very clean place and very nice atmosphere to be in! Would recommend for both visiting tourists, long term staying expats, and locals alike. ♥️ thank you team Khao - So- I! Just a bit of an update/edit, I was feeling a bit hungry so I opted to add toppings (beef tendons and beef shank) worth it! good portions and they came in with the broth soup they were cooked in. Umami was over loaded.

I had an absolutely incredible experience here today and because of this I had to give it a five star review. The flavours were absolutely mind blowing - despite not liking spicy food (and it was very spicy for me) - the taste was so worth it. Plus, I just want to say that the staff are all fantastic and are happy to help with anything you need! Don’t miss this place if you are coming to Chiang Mai

Fantastic delicious and fun! We got the dumplings and beef with noodles and loved them. The dessert was a creamy and tangy lemon pudding. Great atmosphere, oh and try the butterfly pea lime juice drink! 10/10

The place gives off soft Ghibli vibes, calming atmosphere. Tried the Khao Soi and it was super comforting, creamy, not too spicy. Staff were really sweet and friendly, felt like being served by an old friend. especially the lady that i put the picture in here she was so nice. Definitely coming back next time I’m in Chiang Mai!

Amazing! Clean and the service was most definitely chefs kiss! Our server was phenomenal, kept it real while still creating a chill and professional environment. As someone who’s worked in the food service industry for years, that’s serious talent. The meal portions were perfect, slightly larger than I expected which was exactly what I love at an establishment. Attentive service all around from everyone. Would gladly recommend this place. Chefs are clearly quite skilled.

Real Khao Soi lovers know — Khao So i is where it’s at. Bold flavors, silky noodles, and that signature crispy topping that hits just right. Chill atmosphere, amazing food — what more could you ask for?

The food is delicious, the ice cream tastes great, and the latte is decent. I went on Saturday, and it was quite crowded. The tables are a bit too close to each other, but the lively atmosphere was nice. The best part, though, was the staff — well-organized, service-minded, quick, and attentive. Truly impressive! There’s also convenient parking available.

Super delicious curry noodles with authentic Japanese décor. The broth is rich and flavorful, and the noodles are perfectly cooked. Highly recommended for curry lovers! The waitress, 金斯蘭, was really nice and made our visit even more enjoyable."

My family order Khao Soi in Khao-So-i and fried rice with pork. The meat its very tender and so good to eat(not many meat like this) The fried rice so delicious, i eat it first and make me remind of my country (Even we are in Thai) The service is excelent, understanding (even i can speak Thai), delightful and so fast in serving (under 5 minutes) 👍🏻👍🏻 Hopefully one day i can visit here again

From the decor and ambience. To the presentation and taste of the food. You will not be disappointed. The staff is very friendly and attentive. This needs to be on your must try list for Chiang Mai. To top It off the ice cream is a great finishing dish to have before you leave.
Not sure how to categorize the restaurant. Perhaps Japanese-style fusion northern-Thai food would do.

Excellent food and atmosphere, prices are very reasonable for a simple but good main dish. Add-ons add up but being Thailand the price is still very reasonable. They do ask you to leave a review (and offer benefits for doing so) but I'm still happy rating this place 5/5.
Wonderful atmosphere! Khao-Soi with beef was so good, pork dumplings and Japanese Bun Milk delicious 🤤 highly recommend!
It’s a must try if you come to Chiang Mai. Everything is well served from staffs to food. The Kao Soi here is so delicious that I can’t stop eating once i start digging into my dish.

Had the dumpling with Khao Soi sauce and khao soi noodles with spare ribs and braised pork. The noodle with the ribs were great. Super tender ribs, noodle were chewy. Ordered their chrysanthemum tea as well which was refillable. Highly recommend their dumpling, generous filling and great taste. Definitely a recommended place if you are here in Chiang Mai

Hands down one of the best meal experiences I had in Chiang Mai. I ordered Pork Sausage Kao Soi, it was mind blowing. My wife also ordered chicken dry Khao Soi, it was good too. but I liked original soup version more.

Imagine Thai Khao Soi meets Japanese Ramen. This fusion style lets you experience a different type of khao soi. I went for the ultimate beef khao-soi, topped with a soft boiled egg and spare ribs, total (727 baht). 5 different types of beef elevated the dish together with the thick broth, it was totally worth it. Girlfriend went for the dry version with pork. It lets you experience a different feel of the dish. Similar to a yakisoba. Overall a great place to try a different type of khao soi.

Polite and helpful staffs, this is “fusion style” delicious and worth to try. Their taste made for foreigner which is not too spicy. The taste is very different from the original Khao-Soi. Price relatively high but acceptable with service and ingredients. Great atmosphere and toilet quite clean. If you come at noon you can explore the tea bar and dessert. Parking not convenient as much as I expected.
We had a wonderful dining experience—the service was impeccable, the food was superb, and the restaurant’s ambiance was stunning. A special thank you to Aoffy for the warm and attentive service!

Amazing ramen style khao soi! The broth is a little thick and has intense falvours, the meat is soft and goes well with the broth plus the steamed gyoza/ เก๊ยว is also really good as a side dish. 😋… The service is very nice too, but beware it can get busy during lunch hours…

Khao Soi with amazing presentation! The place is cosy, the service is very friendly and welcoming. The staff explanation for food was also very clear and easy to understand. I tried their favorite menu here, the spice is strong and delicious! btw soup and side dishes are refillable for free!! I will come back again later. Thank you!!

Beautiful soul Aoffy gift us their fun Thai spirit and light-hearted curiosity about us. Aoffy also asked our desired spice level and showed us their menu's vegetarian and vegan options. We tried ALL vegan dishes with mild spice. So delicious is everything- steamed tofu salad, fried tofu with tangy sweet and sour chilli sauce, and inter-galactic Khao-Soi-I noodles with tofu. Follow their 1-2-3-4 card on how to put your main course together! You will remember the FUN!

Beautiful atmosphere delicious food. We highly recommend it was fun to visit. Just keep in mind that things are maybe a little spicier than most. Americans are familiar with but definitely tolerable and delicious. I personally am a wimp and I recommend the Khao soi with Wagyu stirfry.

I visited Kao So I for the second time, after trying it for the first time at Paragon. This branch is the original one, located in Chiang Mai. I love eating beef Khao Soi, so I ordered the same dish this time. The taste is consistent and up to standard. The service is good, and the restaurant has a Japanese-inspired atmosphere. Aside from Khao Soi, the must-try dish is still the fried tofu—crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and unmatched anywhere else.
Food is very good, the atmosphere is very welcoming and comfortable. Love the concept and design.
Really good spot, honestly one the best food/dish I have ever had (Khao so). Definitely would recommend it. The staff were super nice and super helpful as well.

The food tastes amazing and is worth the price. The Khao Soi is delicious, both the soup and dry versions, with a rich and flavorful broth. Side dishes can be requested for refills. The pork dumplings have thin wrappers and are packed with filling. Inside the restaurant, there’s also a coffee shop, and they even have private rooms for larger groups. The atmosphere and decor make you feel like you’re in Japan, capturing a truly Japanese vibe. This is another highly recommended place you should try!

So good!! I can’t handle food that’s too spicy, and the stir-fried noodles were perfect!! Loved that we could close stir-fried or soup! Atmosphere was incredible too! Friendly staff and clean space. 10/10 recommend!!!

Me and My BF went to Khao So I on last Tuesday because of the Tik Tok Reviews. The soup was incredibly rich and creamy, absolutely delicious. The meat was also very tender. It felt like we were eating Japanese cuisine even though we’re in Thailand. I also really loved the plating, it was beautifully presented. We especially liked the server who wore braces. She explained everything clearly and very charming and friendly. She even asked where we were from and made the effort to greet and chat with us a few times in our own language.😍 Plus the crispy pork is a must to try!!! 🙌🏻

Khao-Sō-i is a popular restaurant in Chiang Mai, known for its fresh noodle Khao Soi. The menu features chicken, braised pork, and seafood options, along with creative dishes like Sai Ua Katsu. The restaurant has a Japanese-inspired design and offers good service. Open daily from 10:30 AM to 8:30 PM.

Expect to wait for a bit but the queue system is quite efficient. As we were just 2 pax, we only had to wait for about 5 mins before we got a table inside, and the food was so good! Plus it’s a really nice, air conditioned environment to have some spicy Khao Soi when it’s really hot out. Highly recommend the sausage katsu!!

We wanted to try Khao Soi while we were in Chiang Mai and stumbled upon this place on Google. The khao soi was really flavorful and delicious. The proteins were perfectly cooked and they had the perfect portions. I would definitely recommend trying this place if you’re ever in Chiang Mai!
The service was amazing and the food was the best we had in Chiang Mai!!! Definitely a must visit if you’re here

Best Khao Soi I had in all of Thailand. The atmosphere and the vibe is so comforting. And their food is amazing. I had the beef Khao Soi. It’s delicious!! I highly recommend this place. The staff is so welcoming and friendly. They give you a sheet of paper for you to choose which Khao Soi you want. And the drinks you order is separate. You also pay for the drinks separate. So when they bring you the drink you have to pay that right away. But the whole experience I had in Khao Soi was wonderful. Thank you! 😊

The food is above and beyond, every dish we took was really good 👍 Sausage katsu 10/5 Dumplings 5/5 Fried rice 100/5 And braised beef noodles (with soup)100/5🍜 Please don't forget to order your treat at the end! Mix waffle ice cream Many thanks for all the staff ! All is attentive to details and approachable!

I wanted this to be my first meal in Chiang Mai after seeing it everywhere on social media! It did not disappoint, service was quick, staff were kind and helpful and the food was delicious! I’ll definitely try to be back to try the stir fried noodles. Definitely recommend :)

Best Khao Soi we've had yet in ChiangMai. The flavour was unreal. The Thai Northern Sausage Katsu was banging as well. Also the staff were lovely with fast service all the way! Would definitely recommend and we will come back again! 🤤

If you’re in search of Khao Soi whilst in Chiang Mai then look nowhere else but right here.. stop searching, you’ve stumbled upon an absolute gem! From the moment you arrive at the restaurant to saying goodbye, it’s a very pleasant experience. The waiter/waitress will show you the menu and explain how it all works. I went with the Wagyu Khao Soi with added diced beef with a side of pork dumplings. The food is cooked to perfection. You can watch the chefs prepare and make the food at the open kitchen in the back of the restaurant. Another note, you’ll never go without a full drink or them offering to refill certain parts of you plate for no additional cost. It’s an experience that everyone visiting Chiang Mai should definitely do! You will not be disappointed at all!!

A bit more of an upscale Khao Soi. Def worth a visit if you’re in town. Although if you actually live in CM, you can probably start going to cheaper places that taste just as good. I got a beef and beef tendon one, it tasted pretty good and they have a large variety of options and I believe a seafood option as well.
Aoffy gave us such a great experience here guiding us on what to order! The food was amazing, and I would come back in the future

Love this place! They are super nice and friendly and beautiful 😍 the food itself is excellent if you want to try classic Thai! It’s really clean and definitely the ice cream it’s my favourite dessert after a hot and busy day! If you come in motoring you can park across the street
Amazing restaurant. The waitress Aoffy has been lovely. I am coeliac and she has been super attentive to getting me to eat with peace of mind. The food was very good. I recommend it.

We decided to go all out and ordered the lobster Khao Soi—the most expensive dish on the menu! The lobster was perfectly cooked, super fresh, and the flavor was absolutely amazing! Loved the presentation, with a touch of Japanese-style plating that made it almost too cute to eat. The restaurant has a nice view, and everything felt clean and hygienic. Highly recommend! Just be prepared for a bit of a queue, but trust me, it’s worth the wait. 😊

Japanese thematic khao soi place , it’s very nice designed and good to go in december especially when the weather is cooling. The khao soi do not dissapoint as well, the taste is prominent and good enough spiciness. Many selection in the menu. Close the meal with very nice hokkaido milk and matcha soft serve. Parking is availablr near the restaurant

Fusionized khao soi . Chicken meat is super tender and smooth juicy. The soup is excellent texture is perfectly balanced. Price is reasonable. Do come early before lunch time.. generally will be pack after 11am. They have ample space for parking. Ambience and setting gives the traditional feel of Kyoto. Highly recommend when visiting Chiang Mai

What a great spot! It was our first time, so the staff was very helpful in making suggestions. We got the chicken and beef, and everything was delicious! Before or after your meal, take a few minutes to explore the area too.

That's probably one of the best khao Soi in chiang mai. Had this place listed for long time but just decided to try. Taste was very good, you can feel their noodle is different and portion generous in meat. The price is very affordable knowing homemade noodle and meat price. The queue was short and we just had to wait 5min before getting a table. There is a free car park before for the restaurant if you come from the highway (on the left side once you turn left to reach the restaurant road, there is a big sign showing koi Soi car park). Staff are nice and very polite. Food were served very quickly. Fried tofu is recommended too. This will become one of my place to bring any of my visitors moving forwards in chiang Mai. One thing to improve would be to have a English menu (didn't ask if they have but I manage somehow without)
Food is delicious. Aoffy was an excellent waitress. She explained everything to us so the experience was great. Totally recommend.

Best Khao Soi in Chiang Mai. Even though their style differs a bit from the traditional Khao Soi it's still a must try when you visit Chiang Mai, the flavors are amazing and the service is at the same level. It's outside the Old Town but definitely worth the 15min by car.
The food was very tasty for a good price. The service was great as well, we felt welcomed and had a really good time! I recommend.

Absolutely fantastic! Khao So-i in Chiang Mai serves up the most incredible bowl of Northern Thai curry noodles. The broth is rich, creamy, and perfectly spiced, with that addictive depth of flavor. The tender meat and the contrasting crunch of the crispy egg noodles on top make every spoonful a delight. It's a truly unforgettable taste of Chiang Mai—a must-try!
The khao soi soup is tastefully yummy. The beef is tender Dumpling and pork ball also good , no smell for pork

One of the most famous khao soi restaurant in chiang mai. In my opinion the second best. The chicken khao soi is a must-try, and the beef chunk version is great too. I also enjoyed their matcha ice cream. The service is fast, staff speak good English, and they’re helpful with recommendations—even for kids. The only downside was the toilets, which weren’t clean and smelled bad, but they’re under maintenance, so hopefully, that improves soon. The queue can be long, but it’s definitely worth the wait

A great spot in Chiang Mai for Northern Thai khao soi with a cozy atmosphere and Instagram-worthy decor. The service is excellent, even when the place is packed, and you can ask for free side dishes. Their soup is really good!! While the Japanese-inspired decor contrasts with the Thai menu, the food and hygiene make it worth the slightly higher price. My only suggestion (this might just be my preference): switch the bar-like music to something more relaxing, like lofi. Overall, a solid choice for khao soi lovers!

Went all out to experience Khao-So-i ordering all dishes that were recommended. Food and presentation was really on point and the cook even came to torch the lobster 🦞. It tasted really fresh and sweet and tender. Had their signature pork and dumpling tofu and all were amazing. Recommended to try if you have spare stomach.

genuinely one of the best meals we had in thailand. the vibe is very japanese, some anime concepts around but the food is the local traditional food of northern thailand. They offer free soup and side dish refills and i will be thinking about their matcha soft serve for YEARSSSS TO COME it was DELICIOUS!!!!! so sooooo good and the dish was SO GOOD. super affordable as well, love the servers. amazing customer service, will be back next time i’m in chiangmai.

Absolutely incredible Khao Soi — hands down one of the best meals I’ve had in Thailand. The broth was rich and flavorful, the noodles perfectly cooked, and the balance of spices was spot on (perfect for a mild spiced meal). You can really tell everything is made with care. The staff were so kind and welcoming, making the whole experience even more special. If you’re in Chiang Mai, this place is a must-visit!

This restaurant is very good and very aesthetically pleasing. The food was delicious and the staff provided very good service, adjusting to different palates. Aoffy was very kind and helpful. I recommend trying it out !
spiciest khao soi i had during my trip! worth the visit and the ambience is giving village vibes 🐻 there is also a cafe beside it

I loveeeeeeeeee Khaosoi from Khao-So-i so much! Honestly, I love to see the creativity that they brought to the table from ordinary khaosoi to something much more interesting whilst still keeping the authenticity of the taste. 🙇‍♀️👏❤️ I would recommend coming here! The staffs are sweet and polite as well 🙏

A popular spot in Chiang Mai that serves a delightful take on the region's famous Khao Soi dish. The restaurant is known for its rich, flavorful curry noodle soup, offering a perfect balance of spice, creaminess, and depth of flavor. The crispy noodles on top add a satisfying crunch to the dish, while the tender beef complements the broth beautifully. The cozy and casual setting in a Japanese Village theme (complete with a Coffee House) makes it a great choice for both locals and tourists craving authentic Northern Thai comfort food. Overall, Khao Soi-I delivers a satisfying and memorable dining experience for anyone looking to indulge in Khao Soi.

I tried Kho Soi at there. The taste was amazing - was so rich and delicous - one of the best dish ive ever had. Plus the waitress was so super friendly and helpful. She made the experience even better. Definitely come back again!!!!!!!!

This place has a charming Japanese style atmosphere that makes it really stand out. There’s usually a line, but it’s absolutely worth the wait. The khao soi is rich and flavorful, the Thai tea is surprisingly good, and the gyozas are simply delicious. A must visit in Chiang Mai
Very nice place and very good food, both type of Khao soi was delicious
The staff are polite, smiling, and attentive to customers. The food looks delicious. The Khao Soi has a smooth, mellow flavor.
Highly satisfied with the service from beginning to end. The dishes brought were all so flavorful and soup was still very light and meat was tender :) would recommend
Best Khao Soi in town. We went there two times everything is delicious. The staff is friendly, attentive and fast! Thank you
This is the spot - best khao so i in Chiang Mai. Noodles are so flavorful, meats are melt in your mouth delicious. Topped off with sweet treat soft serve. Don’t miss it!

The Khao Soi here has a thicker gravy than other places with some Japanese inspired elements. The chicken is flavorful and the beef fall-apart tender. Gyōza and sausage Katsu are well executed. Come early to avoid the queue.

Noodle soup was my preferred, if you like spicy tasty noodles this is for you. Plenty Khao Soi noodle options. Food comes on a platter with sides. Tofu and sauce was very good also. Japan fusion, been Japan a few times and the restaurant inside and side alley gives you the impression you're back in old Japan. Service is quick and friendly too. Thank you.
Ging Kaew was very sweet and recommended us to try the unique dried version. Yummy!

I ordered khao soi soup and when i start eating the staff asked me if i can eat pork, i said no. She recommended me the stir fried one. I asked if she can change my food. She asked someone in her ear monitor and agreed. She also apologized that she didnt tell me sooner. I wish she will just tell me when i 'm finish eating 😂 Anyway, great service. The food is not my favorite khao soi though. Won't go back even to the Bangkok branches but worth the experience.

Excellent food and service. The waiter let us try the sauce before ordering to test the spice level. It came out quickly and they gave us instructions on how to properly enjoy the Khao soi. It was incredibly delicious and the chicken was so tender. They are doing things right here and I 100% recommend!
Fantastic Khao Soi, the best in Thailand! Many varieties - all delicious, fast service, nice and cozy atmosphere. Highly recommend!

It’s a fusion and new style of Khao Soi which made fresh handmade noodle. The soup was Its difference style from local and not authentic but give difference taste. We ordered the Khao Sapi beef, Dried Pork Khao Soi and dumplings. Food was great but not the best Khao Soi. Almostphere decorate in Japanese style and good for taking photo. Come on weekday better as not a long queue. Price is acceptable but not cheap. I just back here to try new menu of Fried Rice with green chilli paste and add topping of Northern Thai sausage. The fried rice is perfectly cooked and gives you a smell of stir -which they will come and serve you from a hot pan to your plate. I really like this dish and recommend you try it.

Fusion food restaurant that blends northern Thai food with Japanese food perfectly 👌. Restaurant decoration is all Japanese style. Every plate is all handmade in Japanese style. They have a restaurant, café and soft cream vendors in the same area but separated in their own building. They have a lot of parking lot (don't forget to stamp the ticket before leaving or you'll be charged 40 Baht) Service is good. All waiters/ waitresses are kind and professional. This place will give you a good experience in your meals 😋 .

Feel a bit overrated place, little too creamy on its gravy of Khao Soi. It was merely okay, but the atmosphere and its decoration here are amazingly beautiful. Literally feel like in Japan 👍🏻 All in all, worth visit once a life time

Hands down the best Khao Soi we had in Thailand. We tried it all over—from Chiang Mai to Pai—and this one was unbeatable. Rich, creamy broth, crispy noodles, tender chicken, and perfect flavor balance. Plus, the place itself is beautifully designed—cozy, stylish, and full of charm. Don’t miss it.

Service - friendly and quickly. Food - it was nice and different. The dish of my boyfriend (not the soup) was a bit cold. Atmosphere - it really feels like you are in Japan. It is fun to wander around in their alley. Location - okay Price - bit too pricey Wifi - not sure if available

This place is like a “Little Japan Village” located slightly out of the city. They served nice and delicious infused Thai and Japanese cuisine. Depending on the timing and day, you might need to queue, because it is a very popular place for the local and tourist. They have different type of Khao Soi to choose like dry version with lobster, soup with wagyu…etc. You can also have others not just Khao Soi. It’s not economical, but it’s interesting and worth the price. So, don’t be stupid to compare this place with street food. Atmosphere and service is very good… thumbs up 👍🏻 to the staffs for their efficiency and friendliness.

A famous and popular Japanese style khao soi restaurant. The flavor itself is pretty much authentic thai, but the noodle they use is not typical noodle for khao soi and rather Japanese style egg noodle. The quality of the meat they use is especially good. The prices are a bit high for khao soi, but it was a good meal overall. I came in around 1pm on weekday and this place was packed and had a line outside.
Amazing food and friendly staff. Would recommend this restaurant if you re staying in Chiang Mai. I ll come back for sure :)
Even though they were obviously busy, we got our food right away which was amazing, and the staff was super attentive.

I've waited to try khao-Sô-i for a while so was anticipating this visit. The setting is nice with a well formulated zen setting and general Japanese ambiance. The ordering process is also straightforward with pre-printed order sheets you simply write the number of dishes for each order. Presentation is also good with small wooden trays and dishes containing crispy noodles and chili paste etc. Superb quality ingredients are used and cooked to perfection. The umami flavours blend well and there's a good combination of flavours complementing one another. So excellent overall and worth a visit. Would I make it a regular visit? I'm afraid I probably won't on the simple basis of cost. There's equally flavorful and delicious khao soi available elsewhere in Chiang Mai and the surrounding villages but without the theatre and a third of the cost overall. You pay your money and take your choices - if your time is limited and you're seeking culinary experiences then this will fit right in.
Good food, sangkwa the hostess was attentive and courteous.

The place is great. The ambience is super cozy and ideal for a dare. The Khao Soi is a little more expensive than the other places but the meat is very good. Its a lot more spicy than the other khao sois i have had in Chiang Mai though.
Lovely dining experience of Thai fusion dish. Khao SOI reinvented. The experience was great.

Aroii - very good premium beef Kao Soi. I ordered the special one with assorted premium beef costed THB 589++ (approx USD18++) and it was delish! 😄 There are many other dishes here that cost much less than mine.

I went on a weekday noon, so there wasn’t busy. Since I cannot eat spicy, I ordered the dry Khao Soi, which tasted like curry stir-fried noodles and can add your own toppings. The dumplings were unexpectedly delicious!🤤

The atmosphere is fantastic—it truly feels like a slice of Japan! We tried the Khao Soi, which was delicious, and it's great that you can ask for more soup and side dishes at no extra charge. The staff were lovely and attentive. There are plenty of spots with beautiful views, perfect for take photos ! The two-tone green tea soft serve was a delightful treat. Parking is convenient, and if you get a stamp from the restaurant, it's free; otherwise, there's a 40 THB fee.
Super yummy khao soi, national dish of Chiang Mai!!! Free drink refill too is an added bonus.
Very cosy and warm atmosphere. One of the better Khao Sois of my trip. Gravy consistency was just about right - Spice level on the higher side but it's quite shiok frankly.

- I went pass there during the lunch meal and found that too many people queued up for it, so I gave up and went back there again around 7pm — no queue! 🙌🏻 - Overall food is nice! highly recommended khao-soi with grilled chicken! chicken is very tender. However, the food is not that hot which I found a bit weird :-| - The authentic khao-soi of most restaurants in chiang mai is too spicy for me but the fusion one here is perfect for me (creamy and not that spicy)

Visiting from Los Angeles, California. Had a few friends recommend this restaurant to us and it was very eye catching. The road to the restaurant, ice cream shop, bakery, and coffee shop is very aesthetic and cute! Would definitely come back and recommend it to others.
The best khao soi in Chiang mai, recommend. and best service and nice.

"The Khao So-i was a delightful experience. The food was exceptionally well-prepared, with the Khao Soi being a standout dish for its flavor/texture/presentation. The service was attentive and friendly, and the overall atmosphere was warm and inviting. It's clear that the restaurant takes pride in providing a high-quality dining experience. I highly recommend it!"

khao-so-i definitely lived up to the hype - we are only in chang-mai for 2 days and did a bunch of research before coming. Super cool ambiance and very kind service (tho they do push for a review lol)! The whole complex is like a little Japanese village with Haru House being where you eat khao soi, an R&D house, a coffee house and a desserts shop being the other main attractions. Coming to the food, khao soi was spicy and full of flavor (regular portion is great and very filling). Fried tofu was solid as well, but don’t need to necessarily get. Cool perk is that soup and side dishes are refillable for free! The matcha / vanilla soft serve ice cream has a biscoff base and was crack.
Simply Awesome. A must visit in chiangmai will be coming back to try more dishes

Yummyyyyyy. One of the best experience in my life. Khao-so-i is a combination between traditional Khao-soi and Japanese style. The beef was melting in my mouth. Soup was super delicious. The staff was super supportive and friendly. They even gave me an apron because i worn a white chemise. I would strongly recommend this place for everyone. 5-star is not enough to describe how much i love this place!
Delicious serving of khao soi they do dry khaosoi must be a Japanese fusion, Japanese themed 👍👍💯 must try if in town 😋
The food was amazing! The staff is very friendly and go in depth over the menu… which we really appreciated. So so good!

This is very touristy, but it's easy to order if you don't speak Thai! Prices aren't too bad either, I got the beef khao soi. they give you farang spice, or you can spice it up if you can handle it. I loved it, and will bring back guests who visits!
Some of the best khao soi we’ve had on this trip! The matcha soft serve is great too
Very nice friendly service, delicious Khao Soi soup and great ambience that’s Japanese influenced. Worth a visit.

Just the rainy day, there are slightly fewer people in line, but I will pass through the place where I don't have an awning to reach the restaurant. The meals were delicious. The service is also very kind. After the meal, will ask the guests if they want ice cream. So we ordered two different ice creams. When he delivers it, he will collect money from the customer. I think this needs to be improved. Because the ice cream has been delivered but they have to start touching the money again. I can understand that the two stores are separate... but I think this is very inappropriate. If you need to collect money first, it would be more appropriate to inform the guests when they order. I am very concerned about the ice cream with the cone after touching the money。 ！！！It's very unhygienic！！！
Food is really delicious. I like the vibes of the restaurant. The place is clean. Can see the chef cooking. Matcha latte taste good! Nice partner for khao soi. Recommended!

Their service is good and fast. Ordered dry noodles but it was cold, supposed to hot ? Not impressive at all. But their side dish, especially deep fried tofu, is awesome. I love it texture a lot. But overall not that worth compared to overall valuation. The parking lot is 50 meters away
Service was great, fast and food was delicious for a “tourist” spot. No queue when we went over but it’s worth the queue even if there is one. Overall a should-try when in CNX.
My beef tongue and tendons Khao-sō-I was super delicious! It was once of the best things I ate on my trip to China Mai.

Creamy Khao soi 😁 Very tasty; the chicken was well cooked, very tender. The beef chuck and shank was also cooked to juicy perfection. Highly recommended. The fried tofu has a light crisp on the outside and a fishcake type texture in the middle. Also a must try. Staff are very friendly and waiting times are quite quick despite a long queue.
Amazing food and super modern atmosphere! There are alot of options for customization including meat, add ons, and spice levels. Highly recommend!
Gorgeous food! So tasty and beautifully presented really a must go if you are visiting Chiang Mai! I didn’t find it spicy but my girlfriend did. So if you don’t like spicy food tell them upfront.

Had khao soi chicken (no soup) today and it was delicious. The chicken was tender and tasty. The portion is alright with the price. You can also add topping which i did order pork stew in addition. However the noodles wasnt hot enough which i found it strange. They at least should have warmed up the noodle first before arranging it on the plate. There is parking lot to park which is very convenient Overall it is ok to try for the first time

Very nice upscaling of a classic Chiang Mai dish. I got the Khao-Soi w/ braised shank and chuck eye (large). Very creamy soup with tender braised beef shank. The chuck eye was a bit firm, but hey, it's chuck eye not rib eye. Still had a good beef taste though. The Northern Thai Sausage Katsu was a pleasant surprise and a nice Japanese take on another Chiang Mai favorite. I would recommend this dish. Overall, a very pleasant meal and I would definitely come back. I think I'll try the beef tendon or wagyu next time.
Amazingly they turned the humble Khao Soo into a high class settings n range of ingredients. I enjoyed it n wished the broth has more liquid. Otherwise it’s perfect. Abience was good n a busy place.

This place needs to be on ur list when visiting Chiang Mai The khao soi is extremely delicious and super flavourful I finished the my bowel and wanted to ask for another even though I was completely full. The service was great and staff were very helpfu. A must try
YOU SHOULD CHECK THIS PLACE OUT WHEN VISITING CHIANG MAI!!!! The food and the atmosphere already speak for itself.
Very lovely Khao Soi , an authentic Northen Thai dish, served with thick curry sauce with Japanese infused style. Enjoy it very much!

Located in a cute little Japanese village, we were greeted with super friendly team of staff. From ordering and finishing our meal, all of the staff were very attentive. The Khaosoi was great, umami in every way. The dumplings were also very plumpy, juicy, balls of goodness. Overall a pleasant experience for our first visit here!

With a 4,8 ave rating it’s no surprise that this was fantastic. I’ve had noodles in my time but these were simply the best. If Po from Kung Fu Panda knew of this place then he would say that these guys have “the secret ingredient”

Can't understand the hype about this place. Khao soi is nothing special, you can easily find a better one somewhere on the street for much cheaper price. The dry khao soi is very oily and bland. The dining room is very crowded, tables are set up as close to each other as possible, so pretty uncomfortable to sit and it makes you feel like finishing your food asap to get out of there. In short, nothing special except the very high price, not recommended.
Best khao soi I’ve had in Chiang Mai. The customer service and atmosphere at this restaurant are excellent and we will come back again.

The food was incredible, service was amazing, atmosphere was great! Couldn’t say a bad word.All the food was amazing if ur not a fan of spicy food maybe it’s not for you, but if you are it’s a 10/10!!
Still blown away by the amazing food and the prices! If you are in Chiang Mai, you must go there

So the only thing that’s great about this place is the atmosphere. The food was mediocre. I’ve had better Khoi soi from small hole in the wall restaurants! It also was way too spicy, I could barely enjoy it bc of the spice.the service was also so , so. We had a group of 6 and they separated us , 4 at one table and 2 of us at a table across the room! If you want to just see a cool area that looks Japanese with Thai food then by all means go and take pictures.
Amazing Khao Soi! The beef was tender and flavorful, and the broth was rich and perfectly spiced. Friendly, fast service made the experience even better. Highly recommend!
The dish was delicious, flavoured and not too spicy. I ordered a small portion and it was more than enough. The service was amazing. I highly recommend stopping by if you’re in Chiang Mai.
Having really good time at restaurant with Mimi and aoffy 💕😚 totally worth the price of extra service and good foods here ! Do not skip this place when you come to Chiang Mai 😍
Best khao soi we had in Thailand. Delicious, fresh, really well done. And great service from Tanin/Tran :)

A fusion and premium KaoSoi per se and it still keep its character. Even though the place is decorated so Japanese the main dish here is KaoSoi. The atmosphere outside is very good and so instragramable. Let’s start with the appetizer, which I think is all creative. I tried the northern sausage and it was interesting. I enjoy it. For the KaoSoi you can select the main topping first like pork, beef, seafood and etc. Then you choose the noodles to serve as a curry or dry. Personally, I like curry and surprisingly the pork rib one is my favorite. Their slow coof beef is a bit chewy for me. The portion is slightly Thai, not super full. The coffee cafe is nice and relaxing. There are dark and medium roster beans for your selection. All prices are acceptable and no additional charge. I parked at the nearby hotel and paid 40 Baht. I think it is safe and does not disrupt others.

Beautiful japanese-styled restaurant. The khao soi soup was creamy and tasty..but nothing special. Homemade noodle was good, honestly i like their noodle more than the original khao soi one. Of all the beef i love their wagyu best. Their recommended dumplingss were generously stuffed, but tbh they tasted so-so.
It’s a must-try Khao Soi place in Chiang Mai, and I always go to this area, the food is really good!!! But too many people and too popular for me, will still go sometimes.

A Must-Try Khao Soi Spot in Chiang Mai! This place serves the best Khao Soi in Chiang Mai! Their signature pork and chicken noodles are a must-try—rich, flavorful, and absolutely satisfying. Don't forget to order the dumpling set; it's the perfect side dish! We also loved their tea so much that we asked for a refill. The staff are incredibly friendly and speak fluent English, making the experience even better. Plus, after your meal, you can explore and take beautiful photos inside the charming village behind the restaurant. Highly recommended for an authentic and memorable meal in Chiang Mai!

Food is more fusion. Its okay but not worth the Q. We went off peak so only waited like 10mins. Not the best.can try other restaurants. The prawns are not well cooked, torched only so inside is abit raw. Hopefully is sashimi grade haha but luckily i didn't went to the toilet to detox. Added on Meat which is good. But for the price is abit steep and more touristy. Can skip if q is more than 30mins. But restaurant and food is ig worthy though.

Khao Soi is a Thai dish, but this spot gives it a Japanese twist. The place itself is really pretty—minimal and well-designed, very Japanese-style. The food was good, but personally I found it a little overhyped. If you’re not great with spicy food, just a heads-up—it’s got a decent kick 🌶️ That said, the matcha ice cream at the end was amazing 🍵🍨

My new favorite in Chiang Mai since Khao Soi Nimman has somehow gone down a bit in quality—perhaps due to it being too popular now. The khao soi here is to die for, while servers are so hospitable and kind (asked for extra pickles and chili sauce). The tofu is crisp on the outside soft in the inside I dream about it. Not to add the place is super cool!

Opting for an early visit to dodge queues, we returned for a second time to this noodle spot after failing to wait at the first visit. Sampling both soup and dried versions, we found ourselves leaning towards the satisfyingly conventional Khao Soi one. Its very tender meat and a must-try fried tofu added to the culinary delight. Decorated in a Japanese style, the place exudes tranquility, offering a serene and content moment for patrons. If you appreciate a peaceful morning with flavorsome noodles, this spot is a definite winner.

We ordered tofu and beef khao soi (soup and dried). It was excellent and more on a spicy khao soi, unlike the sweet khao soi we had in BKK. The taste def worths the price. The dessert of the day was pannacota and it was also excellent. There is also the “After You” dessert place behind this place, with nice Japanese style touch.
amazing khao soi, all 7 of us really enjoyed it! our waitress aoffy was super lovely and helpful, as well as the rest of the staff!
extremely good food. they take care of products and fantastic service. thanks to our waitress Ging. we will be back soon.

I had a great experience at Khao Soi I! The food was delicious, capturing the authentic flavors that Khao Soi is known for. The environment was welcoming and comfortable, creating a lovely spot to enjoy a meal. The service was impressively efficient, with friendly staff who ensured everything was just right. If you’re in the area, I highly recommend giving them a try!
Stunning food with great service would 100% recommend making the trip here to try the food!

Food was amazing. The creamiest noodle I ever had in my life. The location was so pretty and well detailed. It felt like I was transported right into Japan itself. The service was also welcoming, sweet and very friendly :) I felt pretty noticed which made the stay even better Highly recommend it if you coming to chiang mai

If there is one dish quintessential with northern Thai food, it has to be Khao Soi. If that’s not reason enough to visit Khao-So-i, then their creative interpretation of this delicious meal deserves a visit. To be clear, if you’re visiting Chiang Mai, this place should be on your ‘must go’ list. There are traditional soup versions along with many new variations such as stir fried Khao Soi. The place is always packed, but lots of friendly staff and a well organised seating system means you won’t have to wait long … they also have a specialty Hokkaido soft serve ice cream stall at the entrance if the line is long 🍦 Great vibe in the atmosphere, food and staff. Highly recommend this place.

The unique taste of Khao Soi is here... Cause there is a Thai & Japanese fusion Khao Soi... There are many other interesting menus too... The well designed & Bulit Japanese landscaping & Architecture are stunning... This is one of the must go place in Chiang Mai...
Superb atmosphere & foods. Amazing service mind.
Khao So I was lovely! Fast and attentive folks working in a cute and spacious location. The food was good!
amaizing food, great staff and very good atmosphere.

I like the food here, more like a fusion & deconstructed. Staff is very nice, polite & attentive. They can recommend foods and signature, they asked if this is my first time so that they can suggest foods. Pork steamed dumpling is a must try menu, dipping sauce is nice, tasted like ponzu sauce. I ordered dried khao soi with chicken & topping with pork ball, with fresh noodle fried with egg. Tasted ok but maybe its a little bit plain in a way. However, overall i had a good experience here. There are many seats inside & parking lot is available for free, can park up to 15 cars. I went around 4pm so its not that busy. I would still recommend the place though. Price is also cheap compared to portion & quality. Just 300 THB for 2 dishes.

crazy good food, spicy and savory, with tasty drinks and delicious ice cream we got to have a taste of the khao soi soup before ordering it to see if it was too spicy for us which was really nice staff here is amazing and I’m really happy we found this place, it enhanced our Chiang Mai trip by a mile
Nice staffs and delicious northern food in modern style. MUST TRY IF YOU TRAVEL CHIANG MAI
The food was unbelievable good and tasted so fresh and rich!! Service was quick! Service was perfect friendly you name it!. 20/10

Very creative menu combinations between local dish like Khao Soi with Japanese fusion style. The area is well designed and decorated giving Japanese village vibes. Staff are well trained and accommodating! Highly recommended!!
Just go. You there is no way to be disappointed in this place. The khaosoi is just spectacular.

We are so look forward to try this shop as we read & watched so many recommendations about this. However, we are disappointed. We ordered the shrimp, and it’s obviously frozen shrimp 🍤 and its chewy ?? For the people who into seafood and shrimp would definitely can tell that’s no the thing and yet the prize isn’t frozen shrimp price. The place is special, love the decoration (even though the dining area is tiny and congested). I would rate average about this shop, in term of taste, price & food quality.
Incredible food with amazing service. The Wagyu beef was 10/10. Tearing apart with chopsticks and delicious. Definitely recommend, one of my favourite meals to date.
We tried couple of khao soi menu there, but I forgot all the name. Actually for the noodle and curry just OK. What makes here special I think mostly were the topping. Try it. It was worth it
Highly recommended for anyone who loves Khao Soi or wants to try something new and authentic.

Incredible Kao Soi! I've had quite a few now in my time in Chiang Mai and this was definitely the best one yet. Everything tasted very fresh and homemade, the noodles were thick and chewy and the crispy noodles on top were way better than the ones you get most places. I opted for the expensive version with mixed beef on top, among it some Wagyu, and though the price was up there it was incredible! Definitely worth it if you're willing to spend a little extra.
The atmosphere and food blew me away! Very accessible to those who might not be as tolerant to spice, but preserves the authentic taste of northern Thailand who those who can with a Japanese twist.

This is truly a culinary institution in Chiang Mai serving the best khao soy in the city. If you only have time to visit one restaurant here, this is it. A word of warning, this is a relatively small eatery and is always packed. Do expect to queue. Once inside, you're in another world. I love the Japanese decor aesthetics and pleasent aromas from the kitchen. Ordered the Waygu and Shrimp & Tobiko noodles and both were extremely flavorful and cooked to perfection. Just simply brilliant.

Finally got to try the OG khao soi here! It’s so famous they just opened one in Bangkok 😄. The khaosoi here is really unique and tasty. Texture of noodles is so soft and different from the traditional kinds. Presentation of dishes are just 💯💯😍🫶! Everything is prepared fresh right in front of you. Particularly LOVE the beef chuck eye soup based khaosoi. The meat is so soft and smooth 🥩👍. Also here that I tried the DRY version for the first time 😂, it’s nice, but the soup one is better! 😝 Dumplings as an appetiser was great too, very soft and filled with meat. 🥟 Love the layout of the shop as well. It’s in a traditional Japanese inn setting and I felt instantly transported back to Japan 🇯🇵. The ambience, food and service is just lovely 🥰!!
Amazing food and a great atmosphere! Best service and we all had a very fun night here!
Everything was amazing! Don’t forget to try the ice cream!
One of the best Khao Soi in Chiang Mai! 😋 Variety of dishes, including options for vegetarians, gluten-free, and non-spicy dishes
Aoffy is the best waitress I’ve had in my life. Amazing food. She is very nice !
The tofu was the only vegetarian option available. To make vegan you'll need to get the gluten free option as the noodles themselves have egg. It was really tasty 🤤

Very good service and staff. However the portions are quite small - I would probably recommend you to go somewhere more local, the portions will be bigger for less money and the quality will be the same! The food does taste good tho!
Really taste like Japan and Japan theme ways more better . Service really great and food was too delicious.

We had great dinner at this place and our waiter Billy did a great job and made us feel very welcome. The khao soi is not your usual khao soi but it's a nice change and something you won't eat every day.

Never order the shrimp noodle here, already came here several times for its high quality, but only beef quality is nice, the shrimp is not fresh, but frozen ! At this price please use fresh shrimp at least!

The best Khao Soi in Chiang Mai, without a doubt. The food is outstanding, but what truly sets this place apart is the service. The entire team is friendly, attentive, and makes sure every detail is perfect. A special mention to Aoffy, who welcomed us with a big smile, gave great recommendations, and took care of us throughout the meal. Her warmth and attention made the experience unforgettable. We’ll definitely be back, and we highly recommend this place. Thank you for such a memorable experience!

Wonderful restaurant with a large menu! Ate the khao soi beef noodle soup and it was delicious! They showed me how to eat it properly, the service was fast and everyone was very kind. A must eat in Chiang Mai!

Very welcome service. When l leave some waiter said goodbye remembered my name (l told when booking) Fusion northern noodles with japanese decorations. A bit spicy for noodle. Good taste but small portion. Better add meat. We go for 2 and order 3 plates which not full 😅 Parking available in 50 meters but staff at parking lot said can park only left side as the shop rent only left side along the wall otherwise have to pay for parking.

This has to be a ‘Must Eat’ Chiang Mai experience- it’s AMAZING! I recommend the stir fried Khao Soi with soup on the side. Such rich flavors, my mouth is watering as I remember this delicious meal!! I was so keen to go there and read the reviews about lines, but I was the first one there and got to have some lovely quiet moments in what feels like ancient Japan. My 4th visit now (June 23’) and I’ve never had to line up. Food continues to be amazing and the Hokkaido milk ice cream was refreshing.
Japanese-inspired Khao soi - a great twist. I had the scallops and prawns, with torched chuck roll, it was all so fresh. Tables are on a walk-in basis and we waited around 10 minutes at noon.
Very delicious and interesting fusion of Khao Soi and Japanese. It was incredible.

Known for their unique twist on Khao Soi (Northern Thai noodle) with a hint of Japanese flair. I'm not usually a Khao Soi fan due to its thickness, but this one's a game-changer. The soup's just right, not overwhelmingly soupy. And let's talk about those scrumptious steamed wontons! 🥟😋

Heard so much hype about this place from social network. Determined to try it out. We arrived at 11.30 and waited 40 minutes at the seating area. Staff promptly attended to us to explain menu and get food ordered during the wait. The dining place is 2 storied japanese style building, with traditional open kitchen. It is packed with hundred enthusiasts who'd like to try out the famous Khao Soi. Vibe is good. Music selection is hip. Ventilation can be improved. Food arrived quickly after we were seated. Food is stylish and meets expectations. Lobster could be more fresh to bring out the meat sweetness. Considering the number of customers, this restaurant is incredibly managed. Definitely worth a try.
Good food, good service and good experience. Its totally worth it to eat here

Quite busy place you need to come early. When I got here at 11am it is already 93 ques. Wait about 30 min. You can order while wait. The staffs is friendly with service mind. We order beef and lobster khao soi. Tasty and lobster was fresh sweet meat. The beef is good. When order refill ice tea, staff refill quite often. Great taste and good service. Free parking 50m. The price range medium to high. I recommend.
All of staff are very attentive especially Khun Gingkaew. The food taste really nice. Definitely coming back again.
The best Khao soi I've had in Chiang Mai. Lovel wait staff as well. Aoffy was especially lovely and attentive.
Nice environment but many people and crews are not attentive due to many customers but overall they are good. And need to check with them if they have soup , I think the menu is not helpful

Fusion Khao soi in fast food concept. Extremely friendly staffs. I picked the beef dried Khao soi, but then I have not informed by the staff half of the beef is consider extra topping until I got my receipt. Beautiful Japanese styled architecture. Foods tastes good but could be improved, as the noodle was taking out from the rice cooker instead of cook upon order is placed. Long Q most of the time.
The khao soi was amazing it was spicy a bit sour and definitely deserves a 5 star
Great meal and excellent service. Great service from Aoffy

I feel like I need to leave this review after the experience I had at this place last night. The food was terrible. The chicken was not fresh and is warmed up by some kind of gasoline flame which you can taste on the chicken. The chicken its self was lukewarm as well and the whole meal itself. Driving home I wanted to vomit and both me and my girlfriend were up during the night on the toilet. & still today we are constantly on the toilet. This is why I felt the need to write this review. Other than the food being terrible, the staff were nice and polite. I hope the restaurant can serve fresh hot food in the future rather than warm gasoline chicken which leaves you feeling sick. Thank you

One of the best meals that I had in my trip in Thailand. I drove there with my bike, it took about 10 minutes also had a parking lot. The taste of the food was great and staff were really friendly even though I was the only foreigner there at the time.
I've tried tiramisu and matcha latte at Koteji cafe' which was really good tho, not too sweet and matcha was strong.

Nice restaurant with good food and service. We came around 10.30am and there was no queue. We order Khao Soi beef, khao soi pork and the dumplings. The noodles were good. Dumplings so so only. The green tea ice cream is worth a try too

The place is located with a Japanese inspired street filled with a tea house and desert shop. The Khao Soi here is having a Japanese twist due to the founder falling in love with the Northern Thai dish. We went twice the first time was amazing, we had we wait at the queue for around 15-20 mins. The second time we went was around 5/6pm and we were in right away as there was no queue. The food the second time was okay not as the first time, but I will always come back for their Matcha ice cream as it is super delicious and good during the hot weather.

This was absolutely fantastic and delicious. The flavors were all authentic and delivered at top quality. The khao soi is crafted to well with such attention to detail- each component is executed beautifully, from the texture of the noodles to the taste of the broth. Truly a wonderful experience and I hope to come back. Prawns were so soft and tender, tofu was bouncy and flavorful, presentation was great and atmosphere is lovely.

TLDR: overall the experience was really good, clean, good food, good service, nice atmosphere. A bit crowded and some items are pricey but nothing that made my experience bad. I would come again. Overall this is a pretty unique Khao Soi restaurant that aims to elevate the classic Khao Soi. Food: the food is flavorful and a slightly different take on Khao soi while staying true to the classic flavors. I ordered the beef Khao soi and the noodles were good and slightly chewy, to my tastes. The soup is flavorful and the beef was tender. As an appetizer I ordered their signature dumplings and was very impressed. Each dumpling is filled with a lot of meat and the sauce has a nice tang to it.
