The presentation of the food is one of the most impressive parts and elevates the experience for me. There is also ice cream and a small cafe that’s part of the restaurant that I’ll touch on later. Service: The service seems efficient and good overall. Despite being packed with people they really try to get to everyone in time. They are polite and are always moving, asking if you want refills or anything. The place is often crowded. It the turnover rate is quite good so the wait isn’t that long. Once someone leaves the waiters and waitresses are quick to clean it and call in the next customer. Facilities and other: the bathroom is clean. There is an ice cream soft serve shop and a cafe that are a part of the restaurant adding to the experience. The ice cream is very cute albeit a bit pricey.

A unique twist on the typical Khao Soi. The founding chefs worked in Japan and France and the place was packed on a weekend and filled with locals. Food came really quickly and we really enjoyed the recommended options (khao soi soup with beef and stir fried khao soi dry). The curry was slightly sweet and it came with some broth and coconut milk to adjust the thickness of the soup to your preference. It was not too spicy, but we did request to tone down on the spiciness. The dumplings were recommended but not my favourite although the dipping sauce provided was excellent. The decor was very Japanese and creative! The wait staff showed us photos of the food on an iPad whilst we waited for a seat and gave some good recommendations on what to try.
Great khao soi - very rich broth and chicken and pork on top. Aoffi my server was so kind and attentive. A great lunch experience!

The premium beef dish is worth the price. The beef is very tender. I try both dry and soup. I personally prefer the soup one. Considering that there are long queue, the waiting time and serving time are reasonable. Well managed. I also like the dumplings. Mix well with the dip.
Wanted to try the original chicken khao soi. AMAZING. Really delicious. It's definitely worth going here
Simply the best khao soy experience in Chiang Mai 🐘 🫶🏻 But definitely skip the dumplings since they are a very heavy chewy meatball. Not aroy ☹️

There’s a wide range of Khao Soi options, including vegetarian and seafood-only. You may ask for unlimited soup-, and condiment-refills. Very tasty & clean, yet affordable. Very nice atmosphere, especially for those invested in Japanese culture and architecture. Place’s cozy and warm, with two separate seating areas. For European and American tourists: the kitchen’s completely clean, with enough staff, all of which have a basic knowledge of English at least. There’s no wait, there always is a waiter to look out for you. Also visited their café, although nice and inviting, there are no alternative milk options. 1 drink + 1 dessert is around the same price as what you’d pay per person at the restaurant.

The food was pretty meh, and the atmosphere didn’t match the price. The table setup was terrible and made the whole place feel cramped, it was overly crowded and uncomfortable. There’s plenty of parking space though.
Cool spot. The Khao soi was delicious. They also explain the history of Khao-Sō-i in there outside area they have.
Beautiful place with great garden and nice atmosphere for eating. The staff Aoffy very nice and very talkative, great service!

Beautiful serene gem of a place in chiengmai. But best of all AMAZING flavoursome food. Fusion can honestly be a hit and miss but this place artfully combines the best of ramen bowls and Thai Khao soi. While every noodle was spectacular the surprise winning dish for me was the katsu-sausage. We ordered 2 servings, it was so good.

Wow! This place has definitely earned its five-star rating! Not only is the service great but the Khao Soi we had was incredible. Most places have a Khao Soi that is more soupy but this place has a thicker, creamier Khao Soi. My only impartiality was the prices; they did seem a bit high compared to everywhere else that serves Khao Soi. Most places charge 70-100B. This place charges 189B and up, depending on the meat you select.
Food was amazing. the seafood was really fresh as well. Kind of a fusion between Thai and Jap food!

One of my favorite restaurants in the world. All the khao soi flavors are great, especially the wagyu beef and the scallop/ebi option. The place is super cute, giving a small-town japanese vibe. Will always go back here and happy that they are expanding across Thailand.

We wanted the braised pork khao soi but they sold out about 2 hours before closing. We had to go with the chicken khao soi. It's a waste cause we only had one chance to visit this place during our trip. The queue was rather long cause it's a popular place. The khao soi was delicious and I love the noodles that they used. I feel it sticks better to the flavourful soup while not overpowering the flavour with too much carb. However, the joy of eating was shortlived because the eating area was very cramped and we were seated very closely to one another on all sides. And since it was an indoor space with below-par ventilation, we had to content with the body odour of someone halfway through our meal. The delicious bowl of khao soi turned into a gravy of body-odour noodle which was an unpleasant experience so we left quickly after.
We were lucky, when we arrived there was no queue outside. The food was absolutely delicious, the drinks were cold and tasty, and the service was good too. Definitely recommend to visit!
Good taste with local innovation, Thank you for creative and bring Taste of Thai food to another level.
Really good desserts! Loved everything we ordered. And with a picturesque backdrop, too! Plus the people are nice and accommodating! Highly recommended!
Our first time trying Khau soi and it did not disappoint! Lovely meal and service
Great food and great service! 10/10 recommend.

This place famous for freshly cook Khao-soi noodle with plenty of topping to put on the bowl. The taste is fine, price is reasonable, not too expensive. Love the open Kitchen where you can see how they preparing the bowl. Inside this place is quite small and limited seat.

Busy and popular locally (and internationally?). If this restaurant has a shop near Thapae gate no doubt it'd be flooded with tourists. Nice ambiance too - would be better if it's not full! Khao soi wise: very nice presentation, respectable level of spice, good thick noodles that reminds me of Korean style ramen, but the curry just didn't hit the right note for me. A little too sweet for my liking. The beef was tender enough though.

Khao Soi with a Japanese vibe - plating and decoration of the restaurant. Systematic way of getting a queue number, ordering and being seated once there is a vacant table. Delicious Khao Soi in soup or dry versions. Noodles are not as al dente as I would prefer but it is still yummy. Great sauce dip for the dumplings too! Update: Proper parking available now with many lots. Get a parking coupon from the parking guide and get a stamp from the shop for free parking.
It's something special place about Khao Soi. The taste for not the best for me, but is also very delicious! You can find many of types. But traditional is carry soup with chiken
Japanese style restaurant🇯🇵 Cafeteria is in Main restaurant. Good taste of coffee ☕️ Recommended 😁
I love Thai tea! Everything is good

Really good fusion restaurant don't miss this place. I tried the Khao soi with beef the quality of beef and noodel is extraordinary. However, there is a limited place and table may be u have to prepare time for queue. No reservations only walk-in.
The best khao soi in Chiang Mai. Such a nice atmosphere. Great food Good ambience
Aoffy she accompany our family very well. And food is amazing 🙏🏻

The food here is already yummy but I like the overall vibes, the place and how friendly and thoughtful staffs here are, they are well trained, we are super impressed by those all. Totally recommended but hard to get a parking and queue even on weekdays

A fantastic fusion of Japanese and Thai in architecture and food. Was great to have khao soi in a different way. I am used to traditional khao soi Gai but to have it de-constructed with wagu shin beef was a great change. Will come back for the traditional version soon as well 🙏😃
Phenomenal!!! Game kept us entertained and well informed while we waited for a table. Worth every penny!

My favourite Khao Soi so far with everything from the food to the decor being well thought out and nicely executed. I would say it’s overly sweet though. It is more expensive than other places but you’re paying for more than the food here.

This Khao soi restaurant is one of the famous one at this time, why not try. For me the taste has been fushion, very rich in taste . Stir fried khao soi was new . A little pricey, I dont see local come here only tourist from everywhere.
The fried marinated pork neck was delicious, and paired well with the chicken and pork khao soi. The curry was much creamier than any I’ve had so far, very tasty!

The atmosphere and environment make you feel like you are in Japan! The space and table are a bit small. The Khao Soi curry is not the same as local Khao Soi. However, the beef tastes good. Soft served ice cream is very nice, and there are plenty of nice spots for photo taking.

I like their concept that is inspired by some Japanese Sobe shop or Ramen shop. Perhaps it wouldn't be strange if soba or ramen provide us here. Their khaosoi and side menus are delicious. If they have ‘’Oi-meshi’’ service, it would be perfect. They have a parking lot near the restaurant. Staffs are very kind and helpful for us. I really like them and their delicious menus.

It was impressive to elevate a traditional dish to become a popular dish in Chiangmai. Food is delicious, renovation is outstanding. Service is excellent especially a trainee named "Game" absolutely fabulous. She has a passion for food, Her recommendations are on spot. Very energetic and loves to interact with customers. If you are a non-Thai speaker, not knowing about Khao Soi, definitely should talk to Game. You will never forget her smile and enthusiastic.

Cute restaurant decoration! They also provide parking space. Staffs are very friendly & resourceful for the food they are selling. But sadly the food are not up to my expectation 🥲 quite expensive if compare to amount of food and price of local restaurant. Creative fusion food and nice plate display.

Wanted to find a good khao Soi dish while visiting Chiang Mai. I may have found my favorite dish of all time! The food is delicious, and the environment is warm and fun! Also the soft serve is good enough to have two 😊

Khao So I – A Taste of Authentic Thai Delights Khao So I impresses with its flavorful dishes inspired by traditional Thai cuisine, particularly its signature Khao Soi. The rich, creamy coconut curry paired with tender noodles and perfectly spiced toppings makes every bite unforgettable. The restaurant’s modern yet cozy ambiance adds to the dining experience, making it a must-visit for lovers of Thai flavors.
Outstanding in every way. Pork dumplings, beef Khao Soi and chrysanthemum tea (free refills!). Amazing 🫶

Great experience and would definitely recommend. The restaurant is beautiful and very well run. We got the dumplings, chicken Khao Soi (soup style), braised beef Khao Soi (stir fry style) and the two tone ice cream. Everything was delicious and the service was great. Giving 4 stars because there are many local places to get Khao Soi that are just as good or better for much cheaper. However the environment really is nice. And do not skip the ice cream! It was amazing!
Oustanding. Wagyu beef. Extra fried egg. Throw it all together and slurp away.
everything is really good here and the service and staff 5 star 🫶🏻🫶🏻🫶🏻🫶🏻🫶🏻🫶🏻 i’ll come back here when i visit chiang mai
Very good meal and very good service, thank you to Aoffy!
Wonderful service with great smiles and helpful workers, amazing food. Probably the best council I’ve had in Northern! I highly recommend this wonderful place!

Absolutely love this place - great, delicious food and friendly staff. Don't miss out on their dumplings, they are super stuffed and flavour is amazing. Come early, or prepare to que in a long line - either way, it's worth it - amazing Khao Soi with good quality beef. Will be back next time in Chiang Mai.
The vibe of this place is pure magic. The red curry was fantastic but a bit spicy. Not too bad to handle. Free curry top-up.

A popular place right now, at lunch times, likely that you need to place your order and wait in front before some diners finish and leave and it's your turn to get served. Got a table next to the glass window. Nice presentation of the food though not quite fit the small table. :( Yummy but those preferring strong spicy khao soi might find the taste here on the mild side. I had the dried one with fried tofu.

First time at this famous khao soi place. Pretty well-spiced and beef was yummy, but broth is way too sweet for my liking. On the other hand, the soft cream was great, with amazing service at the soft cream stand.
Good food Great vibes Fast service! Northen thai sausage is good!!!

The queue was not so long in the (late) afternoon, and good system on the arrangement and ordering. Staff service was excellent, they were all fully taking care of all of your requests. Khao Soi with soup was very nice, spicy, warm and creamy. We asked for additional soup, there was some charge. Khao Soi dry - noodles, chicken and pork were cold, and noodles were overcooked (too soft). It would be tasty if it was hot/warm. Dumplings was excellent with great dipping sauce. Fried tofu was yummy, texture was a bit different from other tofu but good taste. It was soft inside and crispy outside - perfect fried (no oil/no greasy smell). Ice green tea (refill), I didn’t taste any green tea note at all. I would expect refreshing Japanese green tea😞
This was an amazing meal, so good. I had the soup based khao soi which is not to be missed. I drunk every drop of the soup it was that good 😂
Must try!! One of the best Khao soi in Chiang Mai (Thai northern style noodle with thai spice soup; mild-moderate spicy), The restaurant decors in japanese style.

Fusion khaosoi here. Freshly made noodle. Stir fried khaosoi is good. The restaurant is well designed in Japanese theme. Freshly made warabi mochi at after you also is worth to try 😋 car park: yes เชียงใหม่

Final part of my lunch… already feeling quite full but still went to another Khao Soi specialty restaurant. This restaurant was a more atas and fusion type of Khao Soi but I am glad that I persist on. This was the best Khao Soi I have ever eaten with the wagyu version. Even the dumpling was top notch and I will come back again if I come Chiang Mai again.

A little overrated, not too impressed with the khao soi here. Still good though… I recommend the normal broth beef khao soy, not so much of the dry version. The menu is in Thai, but the servers spoke English so we didn’t have much problem ordering food. Just another Instagram-friendly restaurant. All the hipsters love it here. Plenty of parking space in the parking lot 50m away. You also have to queue outside before it’s your turn to be seated because of the limited number of tables inside. Be prepared to wait. We were lucky we got there early so we didn’t have to queue and went in straightaway.

Great atmosphere, nice place to have khao soi with a fusion twist and great appetisers too! Friendly and welcoming service from staff, especially from our waitress Aoffy (hope we got her name right - lovely Thai girl with braces and a great smile) who was very informative in explaining the menu to us
Aoffy was great!! The food was delicious as well. Fast service

Very recommended to visit. The service is the best, they ask me whether I can eat pork or not and recommend me the vegetarian option and beef with stir fried. I originally pesimistic about the taste but hey it turns out amazing! Must visit place in Chiang Mai
Staff helpful. They quode you thru whole process starting from ordering. Khao Soi, authentic and new versions of it. This is place to visit

The store has a long queue outside and they sell ice creams to people in the queue which looks good but tastes plain. However, the food inside had a really good quality. And I like how they incorporate Japanese ramen store element into this famous local noodle dish.
The service was great. However, food was served cold and the place was full of flies, making the dining experience unpleasant
I had never had khao soi before and it was absolutely delicious!! Medium spicy and lots of delicious toppings.

Helga and I absolutely loved eating at Khao-Sō-i! The food is delicious and the service was wonderful. Aoffy was our waitress and she was both hilarious and very helpful! ❤️ We'll definitely be back when possible. Also, don't skip out on the duo flavour twist of the ice cream. It's amazing!

The place has a great vibe and the food was amazing. We ordered a beef khao soi and a chicken khao soi. The service was quick and we only waited in the queue for 10 minutes. During our wait, one of the servers came to recommend and suggested us some options on the menu. A great experience from the wait till the dining and the food. Do not miss this place.
My visiting family was really happy with the food and so was I. As a vegetarian, I got the dried (stir-fried) version with tofu. It was excellent. I would go there again.
Amazing Kao Soy. Wagyu highly recommended! Great Dumplings! Wit refill coke zero!!!

This is not just somewhere for food in Chiang Mai this is a culinary experience. From the moment you meet the hostess to the moment you leave. The food is incredible, the menu is focused entirely around the local dish Khoa Soi in every variation. We both had the chicken Khoa Soi one spicy one mild and both was cooked perfectly and very well timed, we had Traditional thai sausage and chicken gyazo for starters. We followed the meal with a dessert of milk flavoured ice cream that was incredible. 10/10 would recommend.

Khao Soi i is a fantastic spot in Chiang Mai for authentic and flavorful Khao Soi. The broth is rich and creamy with just the right balance of coconut and spice, while the noodles—both soft and crispy—add great texture. The portions are generous, and the toppings like pickled mustard greens and fresh lime elevate the dish perfectly. The atmosphere is relaxed, the service is friendly, and the prices are very reasonable. If you’re looking for a top-notch Khao Soi experience in Chiang Mai, this place is definitely worth a visit.
Amazing food and service! Not only is the food the best khao soi you will eat but the area is beautiful! We were served by the lovely Aoffy and Donut. Will come again!!!!

Delicious must eat khao soi noodle dishes. All variations - soup or stir fried - are flavorful and spicy. Some drinks include free refills, e.g., Coke or soda. Helpful to manage spiciness. Staff are attentive and excellent. Desserts in the restaurant and coffee shop are excellent too.

As a tourist from Japan, it feels nostalgic to visit this store. I was a bit intimidated to read the review about the food is so so and not worth the queue, I was queue in line for 40 mins around 14:00. I’ve ordered curry ramen and the dumpling. I like the ramen in here, the flavor is absolutely “Thai”., the crunch fried noddles and pickle adds more layer to the food taste. The dumpling is my favorite, it’s solid, thin skin with less fatty meat. Overall, the food is great! The ground floor area is really sitting back to back. I think they should set up a counter seat area for solo traveler/food eater, for whoever just want to grab a quite eat without hanging around for chatting and taking insgram picture
What an amazing place. The waitress that helped us was very helpful and very friendly and the food was so good. This would have to be my number one restaurant in Chiang Mai.
I ordered Khao soi with chicken. Tasted better than I expected. The servers were very polite and attentive.
The khas soi is good but the braised beef stir fry was cold, I had only two pieces out of about 5 that had any beef,the rest was only fat

Good fancy Khao Soi. I think a bit more of soup will make it better, but still a really good option. They also have Stir Fried Khao Soi. For me...it's just ok. Maybe because I live in Malaysia and we have a lot of Mee Goreng... but the taste it's pretty good, yes.

Everything about this experience was epic. We came around 2pm on a Tuesday - the day after the Loy Krathong festival. We were seated immediately, gave our order and were eating within 10 minutes. The food was incredible and the service was great. Love that the chefs cook in the open! 10/10! Must visit!
We had a chicken and pork Khao Soi and it was delicious!!!!!!! The quality and taste of the food were impressive and the staff were gentle, kind and explained everything perfectly. Highly recommend

Khao-Sō-i is where the Northern of Thailand Curry Noodle meets with Japanese Ramen Noodle in a bowl !!! It has been my enjoyable experience with the food and service. The place was built into Japanese style seem I had been standing in Osaka, Japan. They have a small coffee house in the area as well. Waitress / Waiter have a very good service mind.
Wow!!! Amazing food!!! As a European and a Greek especially I wasn't impressed with Thai food so far. But Khao-Sō-i changed my opinions 10 out of 10! Everything was perfect!!!

Come to eat here several times. Now, more seats available and lesser queues. Food is still great but smaller amount of food compare with last time I came. They are now offering more add on topping for adding amount of food, very smart move.

Fusion Kao Soi well done. The sauce is a little too creamy for my liking but that's is individual taste. I like the efficiency of this restaurant, it runs smoothly, kitchen is well-organised. The food comes to your table in minutes, is nicely presented and tasty. Only comment is that the beef shank was undercooked and stuck between my teeth. The northern thai sausage katzu was a hit with me, matched to the northern green chili and soft vegetables. Loved it.

This local eatery serves one of the most flavorful khao soi dishes (with Bai-Pai meat) I’ve had—rich, and creamy, yet still keeping its authentic northern Thai taste flavor of the dish. Right next door, their little café offers a delightful surprise: ice cream served on grilled bread—a creative dessert that’s unexpectedly delicious. A perfect sweet finish after a spicy bowl of khao soi. Highly recommended for both locals and visitors!

Modified version of original northern Thai food, Khao soi, in the better way and comfortable place to taste. Taste are good and air conditioned made it better. Usually long long line but moving fast. Staffs are good in manage and communication. English communication and menu are available.

Bougie noodle shop. Many young locals dressed up at lunch. You order before you sit down, then sit and they bring everything at once. I ordered the dumplings, came cold, very greasy plate. Ordered the Khao soi braised beef, it had tiny bone fragments in it and was so so sweet. Had to spit out the bones. My third time in Chiang Mai, and I usually love everything. I paid and left. Be cautious of the reviews, a lot of them today were made in the morning by new accounts, talking about how cute the staff is.

The restaurant was amazing! We had a party of 3 and the restaurant was filled but we were seated in 3 minutes. The staff was friendly and the food was speedy! Aoffy is the best server! I hope to see Aoffy again when I come back!
Great place with deicious food! The service was also amazing :) if you are in Chiang Mai you certainly have to come here!

An extremely busy restaurant selling Northern Thai noodle "kao soi" in modern Japanese style. We came at 11.05, got seated at 11.41, got served at 11.50. You can pick the noodle to be cooked in stir-fried (which is more spicy) or soup, then pick your topping from pork stew, beef slice or premium lobster or shrimps and scallops. We prefer the kao soi in soup better. Do try their hokkaido ice cream cone in front of the restaurant which taste really good!

First time there, and it was great. Waited a while as it was busy, but while we chose the menu, the time went fly. All of the waiting staff were very attending and helpful. Finished with soft ice cream on departure was perfect to finish.

Amazing food and experience!! Absolute delight having the Khao Soi and soft serve matcha complimented the meal so well!! It was served with crunchy biscoff biscuit crumbs! Yum!! Thank you Aoffy for the exceptional service!
Food was amazing couldn’t recommend it more! Service was also SO GOOD, Aoffy was so AMAZING 😍 I hope to see her when we’re back in London!! Excited for this to open in London
The food was great, atmosphere was great, didnt appreciate them chasing us out since we finished our food

Innovative Khaosoi, good place to try this traditional northern noodle in a different way. There's the dry kind too which is unusual for Khaosoi. The atmosphere is very japanese, so don't expect it to be very thai. But if you are open to a fusion experience, this is it.
Delicious. Had the chicken and pork khoa soi and dumplings but the menu had some other great choices. Will definitely be back to try others
Incredible place. Food is beyond delicious. Despite the place being packed the staff are excellent. Lovely location off the road in a Japanese themed garden. Special mention to Aoffy!!
Delicious food, great service and they refill your soup and drinks for free

Literally the best khao-soi in Chiang Mai for me so far! Normally the khao soi broth is light and watery but this place is the total opposite. The broth is thick and has so much flavor. I have been coming here every time I visit CNX and will continue to do so!
Great food and atmosphere Excellent service.
Very nice restaurant it gives me Japanese style but also still keep Chiangmai style 🥰💗💕 Very recommend 💕
Must Try! The curry was exceptionally delicious and flavorful. The fusion of flavors was truly remarkable. The sausage katsu was delightfully crispy and infused with a delightful blend of spices.

A Japanese experience with a Northern Thai flavor. I went to Japan last year and everything about this place reminded me of the excellence that the Japanese bring. From people waiting in lines, to staff making order, to fill in menus, to meticulous toilets, to the attention to every detail such as the cutlery and the pottery, everything was perfect. And then, of course there is the food. The best Khao Soi I've ever eaten. The edge is not in the uniqueness of flavors, but in smoothing out every detail, until every part of the dish is perfect. Just go, just try it. The line of locals you see gathered in front of the shop, even though it's in the middle of nowhere, next to the highway, is proof enough of the quality of the food. And if you somehow happen not to like it, it's not a big waste, the food is still extremely cheap (for western standards at least). P.S. The Panna Cotta dessert was also perfect. I wonder what else they serve.

Quite interesting shop. Present the Khao Soi which is the most famous Northern Thai Dish in the new way. However talking about taste, it's still not an impressive level. The shop provide free parking (50m from shop) Recommend to try.
Such a sweet restaurant, the food was amazing. Aoffy was our delightful host, she kept us fed, watered and entertained! Would not hesitate to recommend.
KHAO-SO-I Highly Recommended as soon as you arrive Chiangmai. So Deliciously Yummy !!
Amazing place! We went here after searching for restaurants tips in Chiang Mai, and this one was totally worth it!
One the most visit place in Chiang mai if you are looking for more fancy khao soi. Food was delicious. Highly recommend their dumplings, it was packed with meat. Service was quick and organised. 👍🏻👍🏻
Sensational! Nicest Khao Soi I’ve had in Chang Mai 👊
Gorgeous location designed to immitate Japan vibe. The Khao soi was as good as advertised. Over all, very satisfied.

We came to eat our last meal in Chaing Mai, and got the signature Khao Soi. That was delicious. The plating was very appealing and Thea taste matched the expectations! The service was the best we met so far in Chaing may. We will make sure to come again next time we visit.
Amazing place and atmosphere. The restaurant was packed to capacity but service was fast and food was 5 star quality. Best Kkao soi I’ve ver had

A Taste of Northern Thai Perfection at Khao Soi I, Chiang Mai If you’re looking for an authentic culinary experience in Chiang Mai, Khao Soi I is a must-visit. Nestled in the heart of the city, this restaurant offers a warm and inviting atmosphere, complemented by its mouthwatering Northern Thai dishes. Their signature Khao Soi is simply perfection. The rich, creamy curry broth, tender chicken, and perfectly cooked noodles create a symphony of flavors that’s both comforting and exciting. The crispy noodles on top add a delightful crunch, and the accompanying lime, pickled mustard greens, and red onions provide the perfect balance to the dish. Beyond Khao Soi, the menu is a treasure trove of traditional delights. Their Sai Ua (Northern Thai sausage) is bursting with aromatic herbs and spices, and the Nam Prik Noom (green chili dip) is a flavorful dip that’s a testament to Northern Thai cuisine. The staff at Khao Soi I are incredibly friendly and attentive, ensuring every guest feels at home. The prices are also reasonable, making it accessible for travelers and locals alike. Khao Soi I isn’t just a meal; it’s an unforgettable journey into the heart of Northern Thailand’s rich culinary heritage. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Chiang Mai!
Amazing experience, we were served by Jenny (trainee) and she was amazing and really patient with us. She explained everything and gave us really good recommendations
Nath was wonderful and helpful with our ordering. Food was delicious. We would come back here again!
The Best of Khaosoi for me. The test was delicious, the soup is creamy. It was not so original as general but it fusion with new style technique. Recommended to try. However, you should come early.
Very good food and good service, highly recommended to go

The ambiance had a very Japanese feel, but they did not serve Japanese food. Instead, their menu focused on Khao soi, a dish served in Laos and northern Thailand. Their version of Khao soi was more premium, featuring upscale toppings. One of the staff members, Baiyok, was very helpful. Baiyok provided recommendations and explanations about the menu, including showing pictures to help me decide

Overrated. It was such a disappointing food experience. Although the service level was okay, the food was only good for taking photos and not for its taste. The stir-fried noodles were precooked and reheated, and the beef was torched, The beef actually no seasoning at all resulting in a blended taste. However, the worst part was that the noodles were cold, like leftover dishes from the previous night. Additionally, the soup version, the crackers were not crispy and had a harder texture. The curry broth was also served cold, and when I expressed my concerns about it being cold, the staff couldn't understand English properly. Instead of resolving the issue, they added even more cold broth to it. I understand that they wanted to modernize the traditional kao soi but it didn't work out well, and the pricing is twice as much as other places serving better kao soi. Overall not worth it.
Best food we ate while in Chiang Mai. Might be one of the best meals I’ve ever had.
The vibe is great with friends,Family or by yourself. Food are delicious a creamy soup of Khao Soi with tender pork , beef and many other things. Staff are very friendly and helpful.

This place offers a unique twist on the classic Northern Thai dish, combining traditional flavors with innovative ingredients. The rich, creamy coconut curry broth is perfectly balanced with aromatic spices, and the fusion elements—such as grilled chicken, crispy tofu, or even seafood—add a delightful depth to the dish. The presentation is visually appealing, with vibrant garnishes of pickled mustard greens, fresh cilantro, and crispy noodles adding texture and freshness. The cozy ambiance and friendly staff make it a must-visit for both Khao Soi enthusiasts and those looking to explore new culinary experiences. A definite highlight in the fusion cuisine scene!

Go for the excellent dumplings and fried pork appetizer, as well to see what the hype is about and you will be happy. If you are actually looking for outstanding Khao Soi, go elsewhere - plenty of better local places around town.

Bro believe the hype. This was one of our best meals in Chiang Mai. We had lobster khao soi soup w/ a Hokkaido scallop topping add on. Scallops were perfect tender and smooth - high quality. The khao soi and lobster were so rich and tasty. I had the beef shank stir fry and that was was so tender. The broth is so flavorful. Come here early to skip the lines. It is a certified banger!

Japanese style Khaosoi Delicious not expensive Come normal day or arrive 10.00am Otherwise you need some passion spend times to wait Due to the chef can't afford so many customers come for lunch at the same time We arrived at 10.50 Wait 40 mins for a table Wait another 20 mins for serve Take 15 mins to finish the meal Not worth our time
I tried the vegetarian tofu meal which was very tasty! The medium size was a good portion. Staff were very friendly and attentive.
If you’re visiting Chiang Mai, you have to try Khao Soi — and this spot is a must! Highly recommend the Iwate Wagyu F1, Northern Sausage Katsu, and Fried Tofu. Service is excellent!
It was a Good experience to tried ‘Khao Soi’ if you wanna go for lunch should be there around 10.00-10.30 before lunchtime cause there’s no waiting in line
An unique Khao Soi shop, which serving Khao Soi in a new different way. I really like their concept. The presentation was nice, and taste was also very fine. By the way, this place is always packed.
Popular for good reason. Beautiful spot. The dumplings are nicely stuffed.

I came here twice in 2 weeks and it was great! My friends and family love their fusion-style Khaosoi. I'm local and I love how they present Khaosoi like a Japanese but preserved original taste of Khaosoi even better than some other restaurants, not to mention their fresh made noodles which really enhanced the taste of Khaosoi even more. One comment is that their shop is kinda small, so the smell and smokes stays in the air and maybe stick on your clothes after the meal 😄
Aoffy helped me when I went to khao so-i to have my first khao soi in Chiang Mai and it was wonderful. She was so sweet and the food was amazing
Best Khao-Sõ-i in Chiang Mai, lovely staff (Ging served us and was very warm and welcoming), incredible mains, drinks and dessert.

This Khao soi dish is another level, I like how they present their dishes while sticking to the traditional Northern Thailand khao soi and snacks. I will definitely come again if I ever return to Chiangmai
All crew are very kind and meal is very delicious 🤤
I find the concept very innovative, and it tastes great.

Fusion Khao Soi in Japanese style, thick soup like Kare Udon, extra soup and side dishes can be added on demand. I think noodle given too less. Taste good, good ingredients, nice restaurant and excellent service. I visited at 2.00 pm so I can get seat with no waiting.
Overall, i love foods service and atmosphere at here. I strongly recommend to have northern noodle traditional in this restaurant.
Wonderful service from your lovely waitress Aoffy, she looked after us so well. Great food and ambiance!
The best recommendation! I love it so much
This is definitely a must visit in Chiangmai. The food, services and environment are top notch in town. Highly recommended
Japanese-style, beautifully presented, rich in soup base, and average noodles in taste. Overall, it is a restaurant worth recommending.
Very delicious!!!! Amazing staff and food!
Delicious food, I choose the stir fry since I cannot eat that spicy and it was really good.
Incredibly good. If I could, I'd give it 10 stars.
The food was very spicy but the place was amazing and they served us super fast. We recommend the experience :)
This is a Japanese fusion version of the famous northern Thailand dish 'Khao Soi' restaurant. It tastes fantastic and the staff can speak English well.

Khao Soi from Khao-So-i is another level of Khao Soi! The taste and quality of their food are very satisfying. Don't be afraid that it won't be like traditional Khao Soi because, for me, the taste is exactly right. It’s just their high-quality ingredients and the more modern look that make it different! I can't wait to go back to Chiang Mai to eat it again.
The food was fantastic, with excellent service.
Phenomenal meal. Chicken khoa soi with a side of pork rib and some yummy pork dumplings. Drinks were also tasty butterfly pea and lime juice 😍 happy to hear they are opening in London soon 🙌🏾
Amazing staff looking at guests' allergy requests. Food is very nice. Just try to avoid lunchtime as it will be super busy.

It's amazing what Khao Soi you can get when you pay 4 times what most places charge. Your choice of beef, pork or chicken with more meat than the 40 Baht joints. I thought it tasted great but the prices are very high for Chiang Mai.
Nice food and good service, reasonable price… we will come back again for sure
This place is a must in Chang Mai, the food is really really good! Umami for your mouth. 🤤
The environment of restaurant is Japanese style and food tastes good.
It is the most authentic Khao-soi in Chiang Mai

Great spot off the main road. Like a small Japanese home filled with delicious Khao Soi. If you've had place slime Khao Soi Mae Sai and want to try and up the flavor game, here's your place. Always great to see an upgraded version of a classic dish, done well with obvious care to flavor and quality. Will come back soon to try the other types on offer!
Great service by the staff, food also great I tried the beef shank khao soi really good stuff, will definitely come back
Staff are very friendly, food tastes good for the price and the atmosphere is very fancy. Definitely recommend this place.
It was our first time visiting and we were thoroughly impressed! From the wonderful customer service to the delicious Khao Soi! Thank you for your wonderful service.
The food was sooo good! The service was on point as well! One of the best meals had in Chiangmai 👍👍👍
The other reviews have already said it: this place is amazing and i would come back again when i get the chance.
Very nice food , you’re paying a little more but it’s very worth it. Staff are lovely and very clean and delicious 😋

The service is outstanding! The staff was very helpful and explained every dish to us before we ordered. The food was amazing. I recommend the OG khao soi chicken. For dessert - definitely the Hokkaido milk. Great spot for good khao soi!

Despite the line outside, we got in within 8 min. In the line you make your selection of food and soon after you get a table, your food arrive. Very delicious, great atmosphere, very friendly crew and amazing food. Their khao soi was the best food I tried, both ways: dry or in soup. We tried chicken and beef, both great. The gyozas (porc) also are a prize worth. Ask for the chrysanthemum tea, it’s so delicious that you sure gonna use the free refil
The best food we had so far in Thailand! The Khao-So was amazing and the service was really good
Me and my partner had food here at the restaraunt and the food was gorgeous. The food was delicious & staff were so friendly and couldn’t do enough for us. I highly reccomend!
We wanted a vegetarian Khao soi, and we just got a dry nodels and tufo . They said that even in the soups they have pork and meat.. Sad for it

Japanese-Zen style khao soi place. You can take a nice photo at the outdoor waiting area. Recently very popular - avoid standard lunch dinner time if you don't want to be in a long queue. Pork dumpling is awesome - make sure you order that. Dry khao soi looks awesome but quite frankly I was left disappointed, wasn't that nice. Khao Soi with bai-pai beef was pretty good. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Chiang Mai.

There is no better place to eat in Chiang Mai than at this restaurant. You can't visit Chiang Mai without trying it at least once, and you won't be let down. I love the flavor of the Khao Soi. The soup has a velvety smooth texture and a rich sweetness and aroma. A stunning tray, this one looks like it came straight from the high end. The texture of the dumplings is pillowy soft and buoyant, and they taste great.
Sooo good
Amazing food! Excellent service! It’s a spicy tho, if you don’t want it let them know. All
10/10 would recommend! But make sure to come earlier to avoid crowd as they get abit busy! LOVE the food. The dumplings? MUST TRY and so affordable pls it’s so worth it i miss it already
Food was amazing had the beef set Khao Soi and it was truly amazing especially it being my first time! The staff were understanding and attentive. Service was great!
100/5. Khao soi soooo fire and free refills? cmon now. Do yourself a favor and go eat this if you are in Chiang Mai.
So delicious noodles with Japanese asthetic vibe. Hokkaidou milk ice cream is a msut to try. Moreover Affoy’s customer service is superb and polite. This restaurant is Really worth it with 5 stars
Excellent food. Very dish we ordered was great. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Came for lunch on a weekday and still had to wait about 15 min to be seated. Parking lot with attendee close by.
What an amazing place!!! Great atmosphere, amazing food and incredible service provided by Zegame, thank you so much for the top recommendations. Must go place in Chang Mai.

The food, service, and the restaurant were amazing. We came at 2pm for lunch and there was no queue, we got in directly. The food came with less than 5 minutes of ordering it. It was an outstanding experience. 10/10

Restaurant is almost full already at 10am! Food is served fast. We ordered signature dumpling, beef shank and braised pork Khao soi. Beef was good! Gravy taste like Japanese curry, which is alittle sweeter. The green lime when added gives a refreshing twist. Overal its worth coming!
The food was delicious thank you so much!

Amazing place and food, stuff super nice and helpful. We asked to see some pictures of the plates to be able to navigate the menu and they showed them to us. Aoffy was super nice to us and recommended what to get, the best!! We definitely come back and recommend to friends!!
Brilliant. This place looks beautiful and also the food was amazing, the service was also very good. I got a khao soi which was one of the best I’ve had in Thailand.
I really like the fried rice. It tasted so good.
Very testy. We will come back again❤️
Wasn’t tasty :( All the curry dishes has pork in their soup So unfortunately we have got the fried khao soi dish that was a fail

I’m officially ruined for all other Khao Soi after coming here. Hands down the best I’ve ever had. The broth was rich, flavorful, and perfectly balanced—like a warm hug in a bowl. I tried both the soup and dry versions, and I genuinely can’t pick a favorite because they were both out of this world. The presentation was beautiful, the service was fast and thoughtful, and the space itself is clean, calm, and super well-designed. If you’re in Chiang Mai and have never tried it, you need to eat here. This place sets the standard.
jenny was amazing and so helpful❤️ they do free refills on some drinks and they were so fast refilling. it was our first time trying the food and it was 10/10
Delicious food and great atmosphere. Highly recommend. Wonderful service!
Cute Japanese style restaurant. The staffs are were helpful and friendly also the parking lot is large 👍 really like dumpings here 😋 🥟
Incredible flavours - worthy of their fame!
Delicious Khao Soi, uniquely presented. Wonderful service and such a beautiful restaurant. A must visit.
Good foods and place to hang around

Excellent Khao Soi ... wet or dry. Nothing in the quality, presentation, ingredients, service, ambiance or flavor can be faulted at this stylish eatery. Thoughtfully designed restaurant ... Japanese flair, Thai taste. The standard Khao Soi is delicious. A culinary twist is the deconstructed Khao Soi ... served dry with a small pitcher of curry sauce on the side. A place to return time and again.
Lovely food!!! So good! We need to come back one more time!!
Absolute BANGER! I only wish the portion size was a tad more. Above all, GAME our table host was friggin COOL & AWESOME.
Great food! Game helped us understand the menu and order the best as per our taste. Tried khao soi for the first time and we love it!
The food was amazing! We will make sure to come back when we’re in Chiang Mai. Don’t forget to try the ice scream with Hokkaido milk 👌❤️

Had an enjoyable dining experience here. The atmosphere is on point, it is owned by a US trained Chef, and a Japanese person, who have fused their knowledge to create a spin on the classic Thai Khao Soy. Absolutely incredible service experience here. Staff were attentive, helpful and knowledgeable. Food presentation was incredible, a very instagrammable place. Unfortunately I’m giving it a 4 stars rating as the Khao Soy with Tofu, wasn’t as enjoyable as others I have had. As a vegetarian perhaps it’s not the best place to be. The tofu texture unbalanced my meal and it didn’t suit the dish in my opinion. Although individually the flavours were tasty. I felt the dish was lacking. Overall a great experience, would recommend for the service and atmosphere, and presentation.
The best noodles 🍜 I ever had here in Chiang Mai. This is a must try food. Like so good and yummy. Wanna go back again soon.
Lovely atmosphere with fusion khaosoi. I think the taste is tender and pretty interesting with the mix and match of different toppings or ingredients.
Very friendly staff and good food!
Small shop that fulfilled with Taste of authentic khao soi with japanese atmosphere. Good service Prepare for long waiting line during lunch time.
Food is good. Staffs are very attentive. It’s been a while since I’ve experienced such a good service at the restaurant even at the peak lunch hour.
Very nice staff. Delicious food. Reasonable price. Recommend menu is “Beef Khaosoi”
Not really traditional Khao sai but still very delicious and worth the long queue. Staffs are exceptional, very polite and always show that they really care.
The food is delicious and the price is reasonable. Both environment and service are amazing. Thank you Aoffy for the very detailed and friendly service! Will come again when I’m back to Chiang Mai!
Delicious khao soi 🍜 Spectacular food preparation. Beautiful space. @kate_taraxacum
Everything is good. I will comback again!
The meal was so delicious! So many options!
Must visit in Chiang Mai. Special shout out to Aoffy and Gian.
Had the lamb and beef set with tofu as a starter ordered a separate friend chicken side. It’s delicious many young local was there so believed that backed the long list of claims.

taste 4/5 place 4/5 service 5/5 overall 4.3/5 Khao soi or khao soy is a Chin Haw dish served in Laos and northern Thailand.The name means 'cut rice', although it is possible that it is simply a corruption of the Burmese word for noodles – "khao swè" – which may account for the variations. Traditionally, the dough for the rice noodles is spread out on a cloth stretched over boiling water. After steaming the large sheet noodle is then rolled and cut with scissors. Lao khao soi is traditionally made with hand sliced rice noodles in clear soup broth and topped with minced pork and tomato sauce. In some markets in Luang Namtha and Muang Sing vendors still hand cut the noodles. These traditionally cut noodles can also be found in several places in northern Thailand.
Khao soi is soooo good!! The service is excellent. I recommend you try beef khao soi and you wont regret it ☺️😍
Very nice food. They serve food very fast. Quickly give him snack when he sat down. Servers are patient and showed picture with recommended dishes.
The food was so delicious 😋 and the atmosphere was very pretty. Definitely recommend it, if you are afraid of eating a street food.
Khao-Soi with a variety of non-traditional toppings in Japanese designed atmosphere. It's just unusually sweeter than traditional Khao-Soi.
Beautiful Japanese inspired place with little wait time despite long queues! Really kind servers too!! Ty for the great meal :)
Go to if not must go to place for elevated khao soi. Try the dumplings as a starter!
I ordered the soup based, it’s a Thai-style curry gravy which tastes real nice! Their signature dumplings are good too!

Food here is AMAZING I used to not like the taste of khao Soi until I tried this place the staff that served us her name is Aoffy she was very attentive when my drink was empty she asked to refill 3 times 😱
We had the Khao soi with braised beef and aus wagyu. It was fantastic. Highly recommend.
delicious, flavourful and fresh food! a great atmosphere and lovely service from all the staff from start to finish :)

Wow. That is all I can say about my experience at Khao-Sō-i. If you want a taste of what Chiang Mai KhaoSoi should taste like, there is no better place than here. All of the ingredients are made in house including the noodles. Everything is just so fresh and balanced. Highly recommend trying the dumplings and fried pork neck as an appetizer as well. What surprised me the most though was the service. All of the staff here are very friendly and speak English very well. You will never feel intimidated here as the vibe is mellow and relaxing. After you finish your bowl of noodles, you have to give the homemade soft serve ice cream a try. Both the Hokkaido Milk and Green Tea are extremely satisfying in hot weather. I can’t wait to come back here!
Super yum!!! Tried three different khao soi’s: beef, chicken and pork, and hotate and shrimp. My fav was the chicken and pork. I liked the spice level here too
The food was really good, would definitely come back. The ambiance is very cozy and Japanese looking.
Best Khao Soi!!! I had the stir-fried with beef... So great! The flavors, and presentation were beautiful. Thanks
Nice Japanese-thai mixed restaurant in Chiang Mai. Recommend to try. Serve in Bento style. A lot of tourist and very hard to get queue.
The absolute best khao soi we’ve ever had! …and we’ve had plenty! Don’t walk…RUN to Khao-So-i! Cute cutlery and aesthetic too!

Very very very tasty. Khaosoi here is cooked with new techniques but still preserve the very classic taste of Khaosoi. For those who eat beef, I recommend fried Khaosoi. For those who don’t, I recommend Khaosoi soup. Other menus are amazing as well.
Good food, very good service, the place is beautiful. A bit pricey
Food was tasty and not expensive in my opinion. Served very fast. You can ask staff for photos of the menu.
Delicious restaurant,you should try once if you’re in Chiang Mai😌
So delicious!! I highly recommend this place.
Tasty Khao-soi, friendly staff and cozy atmosphere
Good and friendly service. Delicious and quality food. Prepare for queue but restaurant handle very well. Price is not cheap but ok.
Aoffy was wonderful! Explained the menu, offered a tasting of the soup, and the food was the best.
Good food But honestly - the ice cream was somehow my favorite part, it is so so so GOOD!
I ordered dry Khao Soi, taste was very intense and spicy. Really like the spices and spiciness of it.
Very Japanese vibe. The food is also delicious! Friend khao soi for non spicy eaters like me.
Khao Soi. Fresh noodles. Both delicious. Japanese decoration shop Good job, good advice, good service
weird that the tofu is rubbery. not soft like one would expect of agedashi tofu. manage your expectation.
Excelent food. We loved the experience although we didn’t understand the Japanese theme.
We absolutely loved the food here and the service was fantastic. We came here twice and it was the best meal we had in Thailand!
Don’t miss a good moment in Chiang Mai Thai + Japanese + Chinese food Reasonable price from Standard up to Extreme Peaceful environment
The beef Kao so-i is sooooo yummy here but you have to notice that there are Lots of people , crowded and need to wait the queue. You may need to park your car 50m away from the restaurant.
super tasty khaosoi and other menus are great as well! very great decoration and service. definitely go again
I really enjoyed Khao Soi here. My favorite was original curry version. And don't miss out dumpling! So good!
Delicious! Great service. Aoffy helped us order and we had a group of 13. Appreciate their patience!
Great experience, good food
amazing staff! always long queues but worth the wait! great khao soi and dumplings!!

[ Feel like CURRY RAMEN, than KHOA SOI / Great decor and service / plenty parking lot] -FOOD I ordered KHAO-SOI NOODLE SOUP with SLIDED BEEF(the details of food decor are great and so instragrammable and the taste is good, but the food feels more like Curry Ramen than Khao-Soi. -PRICE The price is upper middle, which is for food, atmosphere and every details of decor for photo -SERVICE The employee here are well-trained and professional in service. -PLACE Exterior and interior are very good design and makes the space feel like Japan / There is plenty of parking lot 50m next to the shop ps. If you are looking for the taste of the original Khao-Soi, there are many authentic Khao-Soi restaurants on the same road.

Simply overrated. I understand that they want to make Khao Soi modern but it was definitely not a success. I ordered Khao Soi with Wagyu beef. The broth was soooo rich I couldn’t enjoy any of it. The beef was overcooked. If I didn’t order Wagyu beef, I’d have thought it was just an ordinary cut. I had a bit of the dried version of Khao Soi as well and it was worse. They just reheat the precooked noodles. I understand that that’s how they prepped to cater to so many customers. But the noodles were way overcooked. The wagyu beef was torched so I couldn’t taste anything but propane gas. The worst part was all the staff were wearing gloves but they touched the cleaning rag then plated the food without switching gloves. I wish I did not see that but it was an open kitchen so it was hard to miss. I cannot recommend this place.
Very Good Khao Soi. Very nice staff, and very very nice Location. The vibe was Great and the stir Fried Khao soi Even better.
Best Khao Soi in Thailand. Such a good meal, massive portions, fair prices and the service was even better.
Affy was an amazing server, my whole experience was hands down the best ive had in Chiang Mei.

new place for the classic dish: kao soi. hip and cool, very busy place, queue acceptable, small tables, very quick service, good variety of variations of this dish but rather expensive if you choose the extra versions. It's fun to visit this place once, but personally I'm not a fan of the hustle and bustle that is found, whoever likes it is in good hands..
Very gooooood eating experience in Khao soi!! Khao soi aroi makmak😋 Shrimps taste good and fresh!! Specially,the Waitress are so nice and friendly!! Love it 🥰 💯
It my first time try khao-soi, it was pretty good, the quality of the beef was solid so tender
The food here was amazing, great atmospheres Gift and milk were great servers and made us feel very welcome.
Great Northern curry soup noodle. It's not just a fusion-look, but superb taste!
My friends and I enjoyed this restaurant. Beautiful presentation and delicious food. Thank you to Nong Aoffy for the hospitable service ka 💕🤍
Great place. The food is amazing! Lovely atmosphere and super friendly staff. Highly recommend.
Thank you very much for the great service of Aoffy, she was really nice and the food was delicious! If I can I will come back for sure.
Trendy modern Japanese style Khao Soi at this moment. Premium with lobster or wagyu beef and choice of dried or noodle with soup. Prepare for long queue ~30 mins during long holiday or weekends.
Flew from NYC to try this Khao soi and it did not disappoint! 😍
Beautiful restaurant, amazing service, and the best khao soi we've ever had! The khao soi stir fried is a must try!

Food was good and staff friendly. I would probably not go again because of price but can understand some people willing to pay this much for the experience just for some kaosoi. However the thing that put me off the most is the horrible sewage smell. There is a sign about it outside, but do think that if you going to charge these prices you really need to sort it. Sometimes also come into the restaurant as the door open and closed.
The food is amazing,the decoration is nice and the staff is amazing,especially Ging,who speak Chinese really well.
Loved this place. Great atmosphere great food. Service was fast & the staff polite and friendly. One of the best Khao Soi I’ve had. The dumplings were very tasty too. Definitely be back.
Worth the trip and the price! Great atmosphere and space and a fantastic elevated version of Khao Soi and other dishes
We love this place. Best Khao Soi I've eaten in Thailand. Nice surroundings and very good staff.
It’s so good! A variety of toppings and good quality, recommended!
Pricey but yummy. Don’t bother with the small bowls get the large then hit the cafe next store for dessert
Very nice foods with premium ingredients The service is on top !
Khao Soi with a Japanese favor twisted. Tender yet spicy soup with a fresh-made noodle. #cnx #travel #thailand
Food was delicious and the service was amazing! Must visit when travelling to Chiang Mai :)
Very yummy, cute atmosphere, and great customer service! gingkaew in particular was very helpful in answering our questions and taking our orders. recommend!!
A top-notch Kao Soi offered in many varieties. Tasty appetisers and great selection of cold drinks. Must visit, but beware of peak hours.
Amazing service and food it’s just from another planet , will visit for sure next time soon
Very delicious khao soy and dumplings, service was fast regardless of the crowd
I loved the food. Wonderful place 😍
The best Curry soup in my life the best Khao Soi soup in Thailand in soup creamy by coconut milk smell have a many herb you can try it
Very very good. This is the most tasty "Khao soi" which i has ever have. ^°^
Excellent experience, very tasty
It was a little spicy but it was pure creamy goodness and soo tasty

I tried couple of khao soi places in chiang mai but this one is by far is the best one, I also wanted to try japanese wagyu version so its little bit expensive but if you pick regular beef or other meat options the prices are very reasonable, also try dumplings as well they are amazing too
Absolutely amazing! I loved how creative they do with traditional cuisines. Worth visiting if you like local taste with good quality ingredient and Japanese vibes.
Very nice staff.food was very good but my chicken was cold so that's why I gave 4 stars.
Amazing experience. Service was impeccable and food was amazing. They even let you try the soup before so you try out the spicy level before ordering. Would definitely come back next time.
The fried rice is so delicious ~
So good !!! Even though it is pricey but Worth to try !!! So good

This restaurant has a cute atmosphere and their khao soi is extreamly delicious! The service was excellent, and our waitress Ging was so kind and lovely. I think this is the right place to eat the famous dish from Northern Thailand!

We had the pleasure of dining at Khao Soi Chiang Mai, and it was truly an unforgettable experience! The khao soi was absolutely divine – the perfect balance of rich, creamy curry and tender noodles. Every bite was a burst of authentic Northern Thai flavor. Although super spicy so don’t forget to adjust the spicy level. A special shoutout to Ging, who made the experience even more exceptional. Her warm smile, attention to detail, and deep knowledge of the menu truly set this place apart. She went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and even shared tips on how to best enjoy the dish. This place is a must-visit for anyone craving a taste of authentic Thai cuisine with outstanding service. Thank you, Ging, for making our visit so memorable!
Very delicious, but the que is toooo long. The restaurant is quite small.
The best Khow soi in chiang. The fusion menu was so good and about taste also good. Must try !!!
Amazing food and great service!!! You wait a bit to get a spot, but totally worth it!
The best restaurant I’ve been to in chiang mai, I come twice in 5 days, the Khao soi stir fry is wonderful!

We came to this spot because our original spot had a wait and let me tell you this should have been the #1 spot. I had the Australian Wagyu Stir Fried Khao Soi and that was a top 10 dish I've ever had in my life. I have never order anything twice and I had to for this dish. Dumplings were probably the best Dumplings I've ever had too. I barely wrote review bit this place was worthy of this. I'd go back to Thailand just for this. Highly recommended if you're in the Chiang Mai area.
Khao Soi Fusion Taste really good with the beef and side dish like fried tofu and dumpling are good too.
One of the best in the old town of Chiang Mai

The most overpriced Khao soi restaurant in Chiang Mai. In a case if you are going there to take beautiful photos for instagram, you are choosing the right place. Visually nice, but the quality of Khao soi is absolutely not worth spending 150B a bowl, and the amount of food was so little even compared to street khao soi restaurants in general. However, I really liked how they decorate their restaurant interiors and dishes.
- Fried khao soi is good - Original khao soi (noodles with curry soup) is not good as I expected. Not authentic taste in my opinion. - Quite expensive - Hard to find car parking
One of the tastiest food in Thailand!
Best khao soi ever. Went here twice during our stay in Chiang Mai
Amazing service! We really enjoyed Aoffy our service and friendly nature was lovely
“Very delicious. This is my second time eating here. If I have a chance to come to Chiang Mai again, I will definitely come back.”
I love the aesthetic details at the village, the taste of curry with hints of Japanese fusion is flavorful and nice for me. Love it!

If you’re in Chiangmai and wanting the perfect place for Khaosoi, look no more. This place serves one thing and they serve it to perfection, and that’s Khaosoi. Just be ready to wait 15 mins or more depending on how many of you are on a table. With 2 of us it took about 15 mins to get a table during lunch. Tried the Khao Soi with Aus Wagyu beef and it lived up to the hype I had heard before heading there.
In the evening, they’ll use the outermost building, went on a weekday off meal time and it has lots of seats!
The food was delicious especially the soup. The ambience is incredible and our waitress Ging was very friendly and sweet. We will recommend this place to everyone that comes to Chiang Mai. 10/10
Aoffy is very friendly and provide excellent service. Food is delicious.
Don’t know why this restaurant doesn’t have a michelin star definitely better than the ones that did
Really delicious Khao-so-i noodles!! Would highly recommend this place. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Good vibes and very popular.
Good khao soi
It was sooo tasty. I think the best meal I had in Thailand.
Very yummy Khao SOI ... Recommend to taste, if u visit Chiangmai jao.
This was amazing, some of the best food I’ve had full stop let alone in Thailand.
very tasty and even small khao soi is big
I love this little Japan hidden place. The meal is amazing, a small portion, but really really good. ❤️
Food tasted great. Service was great and had an unique environment. But would you feel it tomorrow.
The food was delicious and Aoffy recommended us so well on what to order and was very nice 😊

One of the best wagyu I have ever had. All the food was extremely good and the restaurant had a very good idea of fusing Japanese food and local food. This is very fitting and special -- the wagyu was Japanese style and the Thai style noodles with it made the meal taste good and made it very unique.
Delicious food and very friendly service! Would definitely recommend!
Absolute the most authentic and incredible Kao Soi in Northern Thailand!!! Lovely service, beautiful decor old Thailand, amazing food!!! ♥️
Good food, service and a good price. When ur in chang mai, you should try it out!
Fantastic food, very delicious, perfect for us.
food was amazing! busy restaurant but once seated food come pretty quick!
Yummy Food 😋 Nice Service but the seating area is a bit narrow.
From the start, the staff was amazing and made sure we had the best experience!! The food was out of this world - truly the best thing we have ever eaten. I cannot recommend this place enough! 🩵
Very very good khao soi, amazing noodles. Portions in different sizes so you can come and try out a few dishes. We also had the dumpling - also great!
Aoffy gave us the service, and we enjoyed the food very much!
Amazing food and service! Highly recommended.
Very good food and friendly staff
Very friendly staff, food is devine and well priced. Cozy restaurant
Very good service and friendly staff Local food with a twist Pricey compared to outside But with ac and hygiene so its justified
Absolutely beautiful experience, such nice food and attentive staff. Lovely!
The waiter is very nice and there is a beautiful sister，Good food, not too spicy
Food was delicious, staff was nice. Khao soi was really really good!

Had a friend tell me about this place when I first came to Thailand and it never disappoints! It has such a cool Japanese inspired style with Thai food and great servers I 100% recommend this place to EVERYONE I meet in Chiang Mai!!
good service and nice tasty parking is about 100 meters from the restaurant.
Thanks Aoffy 🙏 super tasty
The price is too high not value with the experienced food. And the taste is not Thai-north authentic.
The taste was good but it was a bit spicy
Food and service are superb!! Highlight of our day2 trip in Chiang Mai.
Aoffy is such a sweetheart. Very good customer service.

This restaurant was highly recommend to me and it does not disappoint. The cuisine has incredible flavours and texture. The Khao Soi and dumplings are out of this world delicious. Thanks for the fantastic service from ‘Game’ and was really nice to meet the owners. It’s a must go restaurant for anyone visiting Chiang Mai.
Very tasty food, good music (covers) and great service
Must try khao soi restaurant !The dumplings are so juicy and fired tofu is good too. I would like to try everything if I could
Had a lovely time at Khao Soi, Aoffee was very good and we had very quick service.
Definitely a must go in Chiang Mai. Food is amazing and the staff is more than welcoming and also gave me some recommendations for what I can do in the Evening

I'm ever thankful for the stroke of luck that made us pick this place for lunch ( pure luck) . Food was incredible and the whole atmosphere made our whole trip to Chang Mai worth it 😍 I wholeheartedly recommend this for anyone passing by Chang Mai and swear by it 🤤

Had a great experience at Khao So-I. Staff was friendly and helpful, wait for a table wasn’t too long. Ging took her time with us to explain the menu and all that came with it. Will definitely return!

The best Khao SOI ever and that's coming from someone who doesn't even like Khao soi :) but I absolutely devoured this bowl. The atmosphere is alps very asthetcailly pleasing and japanesely. I hive it's 10/5.
Northern Thai noddles (aka. Khao Soi) deconstructed and present in Japanese manner. Very good one highly recommend ee

Food was incredible, perfect portion size and they explain how to eat. The waiters were super attentive and their recommendations were amazing. The ambiance is also pretty great, much bigger than it looks from the outside and food came out it really quickly.
Best Khao Soi in Chiang Mai, it was an amazing n unique experience.
Food was amazing and the staff was very good! Recommend the chicken and braised pork!
First time at this restaurant good food and good service
Food and service was great!
Great food, good vibes, friendly service. Lot’s of parking nearby.
Nice place, if only slightly out of the way and super crowded. Good food and very nice staff to attend your needs even with language barriers.
Food was great! Aoffy our server was also excellent!
Food are very delicious and Aoffy she is best customer service at restaurant and also patience staff
Delicious food, a wide variety of menu options, excellent service, and a pleasant atmosphere.

The place positions itself as a restaurant, but from the restaurant only prices and dishes. I came alone to a half-empty place where there were only small table near the door. They refused to let me sit at one of the 4 free big tables 😑Khao soi was quite spicy, they didn't ask about the spiciness. They automatically added a tip to the bill. I left upset.
Great service and good food. Waited less than 10 minutes to be seated.
Amazing Delicious Meals !! Staff was very friendly!! Cosy atmosphere!! Loved it !! All Staffs are amazing!! THUMBS up team !!
Delicious and modern rendition of a local dish with fusion from other Asian cuisines!

So far the best Khao Soi I had in Thailand! The presentation to the taste was amazing! Definitely will be coming back when I’m in the area. They have different kinds of Khao soi which makes it one of a kind place if your into that dish. Also allows you to customize your khaosoi to your liking!
Good vibe. Ok food. Very busy.
Amazing food and great atmosphere! Servers were great aswell!
Best Khao Soi in Chiang Mai. Really friendly and helpful staff and authentic atmosphere.
Back again with more convenience and shorter queue but still best in lobster kaosoi ,my favorite! The staff are active and warm welcomed! Will be back again !

Although it was crowded : service was fast …food presentation was good however the curry was sweet…doesn’t really have the authentic umami taste…more of modernized Khao Soi….the dry version tasted like Singapore Hokkien Mee with a teaspoon of sugar. While leaving the restaurant, the staff stared at me…if I am farang…they will wai and say thank you for coming which I witnessed while waiting for my table
Great food, better service

Visited Khao-Sō-i for a dinner after a long day to try the food, Kim welcomed us and explained the menu for us although we were questioning a lot but she was answering us with lots of love and respect, love how shes passionate in her job. Thank you kim!! You made our experience more enjoyable and memorable🫶🏻🫶🏻🫶🏻 I highly recommend the ‘Fried Tofu’ really exceeded my expectations!
A bit spicy for my white ass but the taste is amazing! Go for the sausage and the dumpling while you’re there! Nice little spot with with great services
Amazing & authentic place for Thai stir fries & soups.
I tried Kao Soi for the first time here. It's sweet and not too spicy. The desert of the day was yuzu panacotta and it was amazing.
Nice staff , food are served really quick , nice place and atmosphere Have to visit again next time.
Second here! One of the best Khao soi in town. Recommended
People in here is very cute, the food very yummy and the space very good
Nice food and placement. Aoffy is so outstanding staff and friendly to me

Great atmosphere. A Japanese inspired street. Amazing pictures for your gram and the food was really good! Fast service and the staff are too damn good, so friendly and efficient. Special thanks to Thangkwa - she took lovely pictures for us and was so willing to make our pictures special 💜
Delicious khao soi which was not too salty and the perfect amount of spice! The environment is also very zen and beautiful.

Great khao soi even by Chiang mai standards. Unique with tons of appealing meat cuts and options. Great atmosphere but gets cramped and seats are a bit close during peak hours. Worth it if you're in the area, definitely stop by! Great delivery as well
Amazing food and service. They are opening a restaurant in London soon so I’ll definitely be visiting
We had amazing food and the place was really cute. We also had an incredible and really lovely waitress Ging which made our experience even better. Definitely recommended 💓💓💓💓
food was very tasty and affordable. highly recommend
Staff Aoffy so nice and amazing ! Also the meal here is no.1 in this town😍😍😍
Good vibes The foods are so yummy Everyone should try these once in Chiang Mai

Expect a longer wait on the weekends and dinner time. Plan accordingly. However they have a great queue system and will alert you when you're seating is ready. You are paying for the experience, ambience and the quality. Portions are somewhat standard Thai portions (smaller than western) but you can add all different types of meats and add-ons.
Khao-So-i village is so beautiful with the Totoro mural and Japanses village environment. Food definitely live up to its hype!
Khao soi is very tasty and presentation . I have been there twice, the food quality is still very good.
Aloy!! (Ging is the best waitress ever😌)
Very delicious modern Khao-soi in Chiangmai. Pricy but worth it.
Nice food
Such a unique dining experience, & food and service was perfect.
Khao soi with beef is the best, you should try it.
Great food, they serve Khao Soi with a Japanese twist. Both stir fry and soup version are good. Dumplings also quite nice and special! Comfortable Japanese style shop.

The food was absolutely delicious, and the staff were friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu. They made us feel welcome from the moment we walked in and ensured that we had everything we needed throughout our meal. Lastly, the Japanese-inspired touches were a delightful surprise that added to the overall experience. I highly recommend Khao So-i to anyone visiting Chiang Mai!
Gift is the best service of house, the dumpling and khao-soui is great.
The good combination between Khaosoi and Japanese style. Good quality of material. Staff is nice and good service. Recommended!!!
Amazing food but it was tooooo spicy
Some of the best khao soi I’ve ever eaten , definitely come here , Gingkaew is the best staff! Amazing all round experience!
authentic japanese food and atmosphere. you get to see the chefs at work. if you like spciy you'll love ot. theres other options too. great refreshing butterfly pea tea lemonade!
tasty and nice service reasonable price
Great khao soi, I like to order from here. They can adjust spiciness up to your taste. My fav is the most expensive beef khao soi, it’s really tender and worth the price
Jenny is amazing, her service was amazing along with the food. #voteforjenny
Everything was amazing. Staff was kind and friendly and food was delicious.

I tried Khao soy with beef they have many different kind of Khao soi here like chicken, seafood beef, tofu and more vegan options. I passed this place on my way from work and it was such a good reward. The place is neat and clean, great organized staff and recommend to try their matcha soft serve ice cream!!
Aoffy was very nice and food was delicious!! Hope to come back soon
Great service! Great food! Will definitely coming back!!! ❤️
Aoffy is really cheerful and good at service
Great food, nice staff, super cute place!
If your religion is khao soi then this place is a must visit. You will try the standard khao soi here.
The food was really good. It wasn't sweet too much and it was just the perfect amount. A mixed taste of everything good.

*** 5% service charge *** Service charge added to the bill. I was disappointed by this practice as it's not typical for Thailand. It feels like an attempt to adopt Western tipping culture, which doesn't align with traditional Thai hospitality. I'd suggest avoiding if you don't wish to support and help spread this hidden-cost business model in Chiang Mai.

If you like, waiting in line to get your above average khao soi. it’s a great place to go. The Khao soi here is done well enough. However, it’s not as good as the other reviews make it out to be especially for the price.
Thanks Ms. Ging, she did a great job, take care of all , excellent! And food is great, vibe also. I recommend everyone to come here and enjoy their meal!

Amazing taste and service, I can literally eat it everyday and not get bored there's so many options to choose from. The service is quick and suits everyone's taste buds, as an Indian I didn't feel anything much different than the taste back home. I would recommend everyone to give it a try once .
nice dishes and perfect service!
Very delicious Khao Soi 😁
Delicious!!! I highly recommend to anyone who is visiting Chiang Mai!
Modern Japanese blend in local Thai northern food.
Good quality of food, Thai&Japanese style mixed perfectly. There is a big parking lot just 50meters away.

Very fast service and all employees are super friendly... the food was a little bit spicy for me eventhough they write it 'no spicy'. However, I still finished them all hahaha... I ordered the curry soup, it's too sweet for me and spicy... so it's good decision to order the fried one. You guys have to order the dumplings...it's super good! And you can ask for extra add on like crispy noodle, pickles, chilli, onion, etc, for free... yummm....
Food was fantastic, and Ging was very lovely and attentive!
Food is really good and all staff are friendly
The noodle is really great and the fried tofu is really surprise me. I love it so much

As a group of 6 Americans knowing no Thai- the staff were great and explained the different options with a tablet, showing us pictures of the different selections. The food was delicious, presentation was beautiful, so fast and definitely going back while we stay near by. Oh and do miss eating the dumplings!

The restaurant offers unique fusion cuisine with various choices of topping for the re-known northern Thai noodles dish, Khao Soi, with Japanese (Udon) noodles. The waiting time is rather short and the staffs are helpful and friendly. Great place to come and try tasty food.

It's one of those fancy type restaurant where the food portions are small and served in fancy plates in a fancy arrangement as well as expensive fancy prices. The waiters there are super hard working, nice and friendly.
Pretty good food.
Our Italian friend Giorgia recommended us this restaurant and we are really thankful to made this awesome experience. One of the best Restaurants in our Thailand Trip!
The food was amazing, love the open style kitchen which was like a mini hibachi! All the staff were wonderful too :)
The best Khao Soi !!! Also Aoffy is an amazing waitress she made the visit such an pleasure!
Amazing experience, super yummy and great atmosphere✨♥️
Lovely place good food good service cute staff 😍❤️
Very nice place, good food and attention. I wish I discovered it before!
Good service and delicious food :)
Aoffy was amazing she served us really well and the food was amazingg!!!!
Good khao soi
Delish, so good 👍
Both food and atmosphere here is so nice !

Loved the modern take on khao soi. I actually expected the dish to be more Japanese influence (dashi broth, sweeter, etc), but I would say the Japanese part of the dish was more the presentation rather than flavor.
